I was afraid the entire time that the staff would have misplaced my purse, since it got scooped up with the teenager's bajillion items. (Luckily it didn't). They were loud, and their tour guides were loud which especially sucked in the echo-prone rooms. Until we figured out a way to lose them (we just waited until they were many rooms ahead of us) they were a giant pain. But ultimately, when you have the room almost to yourself, you can really appreciate the sculpture. Truly, Bernini was a master and his works will change your life.

DIDN'T VISIT SO RATING NOT MEANINGFUL. Just want to remind others that a booking far in advance is needed for this museum. This was one spot we had wanted to visit during our recent time in Rome. Tried to get reservations on Apr 21 & earliest available was May 6 so had to skip it. I guess the good side about this is it gives us a good reason to return to Roma for another visit to the beautiful city.
A must when interested in art. The art shown at Villa Borghese is breathtaking. It's a beautiful Villa filled with paintings and sculptures. My highlight were the paintings by Caravaggio.

Fantastic. Be sure to buy your tickets in advance and to arrive well before time of entrance...short queue to enter + long queue for coats and bags ( no bags allowed inside)+ another long queue for audioguides. They advise you to arrive 1h ahead. Once inside...enjoy!

A Gem for Sculpture and Art. This is my favorite gallery in all Rome. I have been several times and never tire of it. Be sure to reserve your time on line as they only allow so many people into the Gallery in 2 hour increments. You cannot just appear and expect to get in. We went on a Friday and for people just coming in the earliest time was for the next Wednesday. So reserve ahead!!! Bernini Sculptures incredible, Canova's Paoline is divine; The Caravaggio paintings so nice. THis is my 4th time to this museum and I always enjoy the old favorites and find something new.
Amazing. This will take you a couple of hours. Be sure to take the audio tour, you'll get lost in all the art.

Bernini's statues. If you love art this is absolutely a must seen museum. There are the most beautiful statues that Bernini created. Don't forget to ask for a reservation in advance, because it's the only way you can enter the museum! And then you can enjoy the park, the paths and the lake :)

Awe of statues and frescos. Get your tickets in advance! Many people turned away and tried to book tickets. Would have to wait 3-4 days until they arrived. We used an audio tour guide to walk through the rooms. Though not all the pieces were labeled/numbered and a few rooms were closed off. My first visit 10 years ago we paid for a guided tour; I think that was more enjoyable, offering more insight. Odd, cause the rest of that trip I used paper museum guides or audio tours--and thought those were great. Next visit, I may approach in reverse since people are very bottlenecked in the first 3- rooms.

You have not seen magnificence in marble like this!. I visit numerous museums and galleries a year, but the Borghese never ceases to make me utterly happy...I should say Bernini actually. Bernini's David and his Daphne & Apollo are such amazing pieces of art that you will start to think of the sculptures at the Vatican, or at the Louvre or British museum as rough, unsophisticated works. Sure, the museum has much more to offer and the building itself is gorgeous, but the Bernini sculptures are the main attraction and deservedly so. Try not to fall in love!

One of the must see thing. Very nice gallery with important paintings and statues. the deroration of the place and the inside of the buildind is very impressive and its location is in the heart of a beautiful park!

City Wonders Tour of Galleria Borghese with Garden Walk. Took this tour on 04/14/2016. This was a fantastic tour. The art works (Bernini sculptures, Caravaggio portraits ... wonderful) were just great. No other words.Our guide, Georgia Darell, was - by a very tiny margin - the second best thing on the tour (after the Gallery itself. We'd put her in first, but I don't want Bernini's spirit haunting me). Not only was Georgia very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject matter, but despite us being late for the tour (bad us), she allowed us to join when we, quite accidentally, caught up with her group. I always find that the guide makes the tour and Georgia delivered. Thanks Georgia!!

Amazing - Do not miss if in Rome - Bernini Sculptures. Pre Book and visit to see the Bernini sculptures as to be so close and have the time and space around you to marvel at the sculptures and paintings is a real treat not to be missed. Make sure you book on-line and arrive on time as access is limited but not rushed and its enhances the experience. Walk through the surrounding parkland and explore at the weekend or take a 4 wheeler peddle bike for two !Finally, buy the guide book in the shop afterwards as the photos are of good quality.

Book in advance!. Some truly amazing, impressive marble statues in here. You should get an audio guide so you can take your time but still learn a little something too. Our teenage children didn't fair well in here as the art is all consuming. But the gardens are very enjoyable - you can go on segways, hire a four seater bike cart.
Mind Blowing. Utterly beautiful building again we had to take an organised tour as entry was booked up 3 weeks in advance

Amazing collection and building . The museum does things right, they limit the people in the museum with reserved times and tickets purchased ahead. The artwork, particularly the sculpture is stunning. The building interior is as lavish display of wealth as you will find.While I enjoyed the art, I was also offended that all of the wealth on display was from the owner being the Cardinal-Nephew. The nephew of the pope having been given a title and almost unlimited church funds to use for his own pleasure. But that gives it an historical story too. It's definitely worth seeing both for the art and to understand what it meant to be a high ranking clergy in the Catholic Church at the time.

Fine art items located in a beautiful building, located in a beautiful park. It was fully booked for the whole week but we thought, let's give it a try first thing in the morning (8:45). Luckily we got in as soon as it opened the doors (9:00). Some of Bernini's best creations with amazing realism are here. Its reasonable size makes it Ideal for a two hours visit coupled with a nice walk in the park.

Set in beautiful park. It was lovely walking through the gardens and park surrounding the gallery. I wish I had known you needed to book in advance. It was sold out for the next 10 days when I was there, so I would have needed to book more than a month ahead I guess. But it was still worth the visit. So calm in the centre of the city.

Don't miss this gallery. This gallery is a treasure which should not be missed by anyone who appreciates art and history. Sculptures by Bernini are breathtaking. Borghese amassed an unmatched collection of various artists here. You need to purchase tickets in advance, as they limit the number of visitors, and time in the villa. I did a skip the line tour with City Wonder. The guide, Rebecca, was well educated and passionate about the works of art. Not for children, and it did not appear to be wheelchair friendly.

One of the best in Rome. This is probably the finest art gallery in the city with a superb collection of Caravaggio, Bernini, Raphael and many other great artists’ works in twenty rooms across two floors.

contrast between new and old - between classic and modern. even though i have already been to borghese gallery this visit was different.the exhibition by fashion designer azzedine alaias was displayed all over the gallery and was very exiting

Unexpected pleasure . I am not one for art museums but I loved this one. We signed up months in advance for the English guided tour. You only have a 2 hour window to visit the museum and the tour takes about 90 minutes. You have to leave your bags at the baggage check.Our tour starts about 9:10. Our guide was named Felix. He was great, knowledgeable and funny and very personable.The museums holds 4 very important sculptures of Bernini that after you are taught about how difficult it was to do these. You will have to take a second longer look before you leave the museums.There are also very interested works from Raphael which also very impressive.Must see

Such a shame!. I would love to share a review of great artworks in the gallery, but unfortunatelly we were rejected at the entry with an explanation the earliest tickets available to visit are in about 10 days time. Perhaps prolonging the opening hours could help?

Simply Stunning. I am not a great lover of art museums. I booked this visit, because my wife is, and it was a surprise. I booked in advance, and was glad I did. There is a limited number of spaces available, and people who just turned up were turned away.I booked a guided tour as on so many occasions we have wandered around with audio guide etc and left disappointed. We left after our 2 hour visit, overwhelmed and thoroughly amazed by the knowledge of our guide and the treasures we had seen. Of all the things we saw in Rome, for me, this was the most I inspiring.A perfect end to a perfect stay.

One of the best spots to visit in Rome. This is by far a must for art lovers to visit. The entire estate and gallery are hard to describe, other than world class. When in Rome, along with the typical tourist traps, you must visit.

This is probably the finest art gallery in the city with a superb collection of Caravaggio, Bernini, Raphael and many ot. This is probably the finest art gallery in the city with a superb collection of Caravaggio, Bernini, Raphael and many other great artists’ works in twenty rooms across two floors. The beautiful house is integral part of the surrounding gardens with magnificent views on the city above the hill. It is one of the most inspiring experiences you can have in Rome!
Borghese Gallery. This is a must when in Rome, quite the most stunning collection of sculpture and paintings I have ever seen!

Wow. This place is absolutely out of this world stunning ! If you are a Bernini fan this place is a must - if you are not a Bernini fan visit this and you will become one - take a guided tour - we took one from City wonders with Barbara as our guide - she was very enthusiastic and her enthusiasm and passion made the visit even more memorable

The most beautiful art museum in Rome (after Vatican). Galleria Borghese is probably the most wonderful museum in Rome, with lots of paintings and statues made by famous artists; Bernini, Caravaggio, Titian, Raphael, Rubens are among them. You need reservation a couple of weeks in advance, and it worth to know that before entering you stay at a long line for security check and you are obliged to leave all your possessions there! Taking photos without flash is permitted in the musem. The gallery is hosted by a villa on two levels and you need about one hour to see it. It is a small train connecting the gallery with other points of the large park surrounding; the trip is only 3 euro and lasts 30 minutes. Don't miss it!

different than the rest of the city. from villa borghese u can see rome from the top, by renting the small golf cart u can make a tour between all the gardens and monuments with a very reasonable price 45 min gor 15 eutos

A fabulous collection of art in a grand building. This Gallery is a collection of art assembled by a very highly placed individual in the Catholic heirarchy; you'll agree that he had very good taste! Many sculptures by Bernini, a bunch of Carravagios, some Tiepolos and Titians, plus a whole bunch of Greek and Roman sculpture. And the setting is just as grand as the art, a magnificent building with decorated ceilings, marble walls, and a general feeling of grandeur. You may want to spend the day there, but you can't! You absolutely must buy your tickets well ahead (weeks) of time, and you'll get a two hour target of opportunity. Keep track of your time once you get in, because when time is up, doors are shut and you are out!

buy your tickets way before you go or it will be sold out.. We bought ours before we went, but when we got there the sign stated that they were booked 6 days out. Do your bag check in 20-30 minutes early and rent the head set. Start at the top first and then go to the lower floor. You will enjoy it much more.

Gorgeous Summer Time afternoon. Spend the afternoon here strolling through the gardens and enjoying the beauty of the Borghese villa/gallery, the views over the city from the gardens are stunning and is a peaceful oasis away from the heat and crowds.

20 rooms of Wow. Book your tickets early.. When we were there they were sold out for 2 weeks in advance. Once we walked in I saw why.. Big hitters everywhere. Bernini, Raphael, Titian, Caravaggio.. And so many more. We got in line early and were first in, which afforded us a private audience with all the major Bernini statues. Moved briskly through the first floor and went upstairs before the crowd also.. I value as much quiet, introspective time with some works as possible and if you do it correctly you can pull it off at the Borghese.

Mind blowing - not to be missed!. We purchased our tickets in advance - and picked them up at the desk when we arrived. You have 2 hours to tour the gallery. Thankfully,we had the foresight to hire a private guide for this fantastic place. You will learn so much more about the beautiful works within if you hire a guide - or do your homework in advance so you're familiar with what you'll see. The sculptures by Bernini are breathtaking - in particular the Rape of Proserpina and Paolina Borghese (woman reclining on a couch) are so astonishing they will blow your mind. Enjoy!

The private collection of a powerful Cardinal. Everything one sees in Rome was comitioned by somebody, the fountains the churches and even the Coloseum. The Borghese gallery is one of the finest examples of baroque taste to be seen anywhere in the world.The beauty of its sophisticated interiors, the sumtuosity of its marbles are quite literally staggering. This was party villa, a place to have fun, to entertain and to show ones guests a good time, while enjoying the freshness of its gardens.The collection houses the largest collection of Caravaggio's in the world, 6 in fact, as well as masterpieces by Raffaelo, and arguably the greatest baroque sculpture to be seen anywhere in the world. Gian Lorenzo Bernini's Rape of Proserpina, carved out of a single block of marble, it gives life to man's carnal desires. This is exemplified by the way the sculptor sinks Pluto's hand into the soft flesh of Proserpina thigh.There are two many paintings and sculptures of all periods to go over them one by one. But what i would like you to come away with from this visit, is a sense of awe of the whole. It's a miracle that this Cardinals collection and this building are still standing together after more than 400 years of turbulent history.

Worth the wait. There's a pretty long queue to get inside of the Galeria but it is 100% worth it. Inside you will find Bernin's sculptures and many more works of art. After the visit or before you can walk around the beautiful gardens of Burghese decorated with fountains and more sculptures. In September '15 when we visited apart from all the regular pieces in the gallery there were also designer dresses which went so well with the museum's decoration.

Best museum in Rome. If been lucky enough to visit Rome twice. On both occasions the Borghese Gallery was by far my favorite stop. That could be because I am extremely partial to Caravaggio and Bernini, but how can you not be. The museum itself is a work of art, with beautiful architecture and ornamentation, it's amazing to think that this (and the enormous park surrounding it) was once one man's personal art collection. I definitely recommend eating before or after, and if you've been walking for a while give your feet a break before going in. There isn't really any seating once you're in the museum.

Stunning, astonishing, spectacular. This relatively unassuming building houses some of the most amazing pieces of art I've had the pleasure of viewing on my trip.I highly recommend you book your ticket online in advance (at least 2-3 weeks before you get there) and it is well-worth doing a guided tour. Our lovely guide was very knowledgeable and gave us a fascinating history of some of the key pieces in the collection.Sadly, your ticket only entitles your to a 2-hour visit of the museum; our guided tour took an hour and a half, which gave us a bit of time after the tour to explore in details the various sculptures and paintings in the museum.Please note, you will need to allow yourself *plenty* of time (30-45 minutes) before your tour to pick up your ticket, get your audio equipment and check-in all your personal belongings - there are no bags allowed in the museum (not even handbags, purses etc.). Cameras are allowed, though some rooms have a no flash rule.If the weather is nice (or even if it's not) I recommend you take a stroll through the lovely parks surrounding the museum - you could hire a bike or just sit on a bench and people watch. You may wish to take a lovely, leisurely stroll across to Piazza del Popolo and perhaps have lunch/dinner around there (a word of warning: if you choose a restaurant with a view of the Piazza, be prepared to pay for it; it'll be included as a service charge in your final bill).

Beautiful Park and Gallery.. If you want to see a huge collection of the Borghese Art and Sculpture collection then the Borghese Gallery is a must. Set in the Villa Borghese Gardens (also a must see) the art collection is housed in the Villa itself.Go, enjoy, write a review!

Beautiful sculptures!. The fact that tickets must be purchased in advance, and the fact that there is such crowd control, makes this Gallery/Museum a pleasure to visit. Oh, and the masterpieces by Bernini, Caravaggio et al are certainly worth the visit. I was a tiny bit surprised that the garden surrounding the Villa was a little unkept. The 2 hours that you're allowed to tour, in my opinion, is quite sufficient.

Can only dream. Book, book, book.... We planned our holiday for months and this was stop nr 1 on our tour. We could not phone in advance so when we got there we were informed that the bookings was full for at least the next 5 days by which time we would no longer be in Rome. So avoid disappointment and book well in advance. We ended up appreciating the surrounding gardens which was in full bloom and the aviary from the outside...

Amazing Italian Art. Francesca with "Joy of Rome" tour was an amazing guide and really showed my husband and I the beauty of the art and sculptures in this wonderful gallery! We highly recommend Francesca and Joy of Rome tours!!

Amazing Sculptures. When in Rome, you get pretty use to marble sculptures - they are everywhere. similarly, Renaissance paintings. So, why the Borghese. Simply, it is the premier league, the best. The museum is very beautiful, and they only allow a small number around at one time, you never feel crowded, and often you have a whole room to yourself. The stand out is the Bernini Sculptures. Worth every penny, they are wonderful. Unfortunately the signing is all in Italian and the short guides are fairly useless. We did get an audio guide which was worth it.

The sculptures are almost alive!. Make sure to make reservations well in advance and try to get there at opening. Well worth the trip and the grounds are quite nice as well. Many of the Italian masters have works on display both sculpture and paintings.

Borghese Gallery - Bernini Masterpieces up close. You must get the tickets in advance. The guided tour was absolutely worthwhile and they give you time to retrace your steps to re-visit the art you want to see for a longer time. While your entire visit is capped at 2 hours, it felt sufficient. The works by Bernini are simply amazing and you are so close to each major work, it is a great experience.
Very beautiful. Beautiful museum that limits access so you enjoy the experience. This is a peaceful place in a chaotic city. I will go again.

Great museum but get your ticket a month in advance!. This gallery has some lovely and well-known pieces but you need to get your tickets well in advance. In April they were already sold out two weeks in advance.If you do get in to the museum, afterwards it is very pleasant to stroll around the garden - a break from the noise of the city.

A little out of the centre, but has to be seen. Best seen when jogging through the Villa Borghese in early morning (ideally when still dark and owls are hooting overhead) - peer through the windows at the wonders inside. Visit needs booking - not a huge collection, but boy is it of high quality. The best of the best in terms of sculpture (not paintings)

Must book in advance. I wanted to visit but could only go to garden. Gallery I tried to book 3 days in advance but no slot was available. Was required to satisfy by seeing garden. To avoid disappointment book in advance.

Little disappointed expected more. Every one told us that we must go there. The visit was limited for 2 hours. It was more than enough. We left after 40 minutes. Unless you are a very religious Christian it won't be a very interesting place to visit. We were not so you can guess the rest. There was no picture that we could say made it worth while. Important !! Buy tickets only in official site. The other sites charge you double promising that you can skip the line this way. Absolutely nonsense! What line can be when your visit is planned ahead a month? The cashier that replaced my online reservation with real tickets didn't know what lI was talking about. Made a fool of myself...

Get your tickets in advance and do not miss it. Last time I was in Rome, I was not able to visit the museum because no tickets were available during my stay. Lesson well learnt, and this time bought the tickets far in advance and enjoyed the artwork through the 2 hour slot - yes, you're given 2 hours to enjoy the museum. Bernini's work were our favourites, but there are many more art works to enjoy as well.Once you're out, a good family activity in the Villa Borghese park is to rent quad bikes. Good break for little ones as a reward for enduring through the 2 hours visit to museum!

Bernini, Bernini, Bernini. We had a lovely tour guide through the gallery who explained the history of the Borghese family and their contributions to the art world. Fascinating! The state of Apollo chasing Daphne is superb!

Very nice display with mix of paintings and sculpture. Booked reservation ahead of time to ensure we could get in without issue. Showed the check in lady our confirmation number. Quick printing tickets. Bag check next to the ticket counter for back packs. I did not check my purse. Beautiful display of painting and sculpture. Very crowded but with it for the art lover!
Book in advance for tickets about two weeks. Did not get in, so can not comment, Though the park is beautifull, but a little tired (Austerity), great for walks.

Amazing. Visiting Villa Borghese and the park around it was amazing. It left me speechless. I enjoyed it very much and faster renting a kart which helped me making a good ride around all the park and the lake in only one hour

Exceptionnal pièces office art and limited number of simultaneous visitors. You have the constraint of your time slot but you get an enjoyable experience in return.
Adding a guided tour is a good option as there too attendance is limited on propose.
Quite far from city center so plan for a taxi or a good walking time.

Lovely Gallery, great park. Young or old this gallery is a great place to visit the park surrounding the gallery is a must and really adds to the trip, with a lovely cafe, segways and lovely fountains a really relaxing day.
lovely way to spend afternoon. we did a guided tour of this along with the gardens. very beautiful. you only have 2 hours inside the gallery due to high demand.

Lovely gallery in extensive gardens. The Borghese is an excellent gallery set in extensive gardens where you can escape the bustle of the city. We booked a tour and were glad we had done so as this avoids quieuing and your guide can make sure you see the highlights of the gallery whilst you are fresh and attentive, The main treats on offer here are many sculptures by Bernini and a room of Caravaggio pieces. A guide will be able to give you the talles behind the artwork which is an entertainment in itself
Art!. Painting, art and statues, I enjoyed this tour and ot has a lot of great works from well known artists .. make sure you book a tour in advance as tickets get sold out

Best gallery in Rome. The fact that they limit no of visitors daily make this place special and not crowded. The collections are stunning and you can finish both floors within time range. Make sure you go there on time as you only allowed to visit during ur timeslot. The garden next to the gallery is very nice. You can bike around as well.

Simply Amazing. Fight the crowds and go to the top floor and work your way down. The rooms are off to the left and right of each wing, so don't miss a gallery. Be sure to leave time to walk through the gardens. This was an amazing day. The marble statues are simply awe inspiring!

Stunning.. We visited with a small group (around 10 people) we booked through Viator. The galleries, buildings and gardens are simply stunning and truly a must-see. Our guide, Georgia, was enthusiastic, engaging, knowledgeable and passionate about the beautiful artworks, buildings and garden. If you enjoy the genius of Bernini and Caravaggio, in particular, you will not be disappointed. We highly recommend this very affordable tour.

Fabulous Bernini sculptures. This is well worth planning a visit to; you need to pre-book well in advance for a 2 hour slot. Leave plenty of time to get here; if you enter Villa Borghese gardens from Piazza Del Popolo then the museum is the other side of the park. You will need to check in all bags (including handbags) before entering the gallery The Bernini sculptures are breathtaking and worth the admission fee in themselves. A guided tour or audio tour would add much more detail to what you are seeing, We didn't have a guided tour but heard what some of the guides were explaining.The building is amazing and the gardens surrounding the Gallery are a lovely peaceful oasis just a few minutes walk from the hustle of the main tourist traps in Rome.

Worth a visit!. Our hotel, Hotel Golden, helped us secure last minute tickets during the very busy Easter Week. Highly recommend purchasing tickets in advance so you don't miss out on this lovely gallery. We had a wonderful English guide that gave our family a better appreciation of the history of the Borghese Family and the works of Caravaggio and Bernini.

Unmissable. This is one of the richest collections of great art in the world. Book ahead, use Roma Pass. Timed entry and a recommended itinerary on the audio guide creates a tidal wave of people moving through the museum but if you do things in the "wrong" order you get to admire some amazing masterpieces almost by yourself
Lovely gardens and grounds. We went here to see this gallery for the Cannelletto collection. No one told us that you needed to book in advance so there were no tickets available until the 21st April.
Well Worth Booking Ahead. The collection of Bernini sculptures is breathtaking. Access is limited, so booking tickets ahead of time is advisable.

Do this one and not the Vatican Museum. The Borghese Gallery is sensational. We picked weeks ahead, just as well. As on the 12th when we turned up, it was booked till the 21st. We only needed an hour to enjoy the place. We did the Vatican Museum the next day and if I had a choice between the two, it would be Borghese Gallery.

Magnificent building with lot to see. Remember to book ticket in advance, otherwise can be impossible to visit gallery. The house itself is fine piece of art not to mention all the paintings and sculptures inside. Garden is beautiful and the cafe at Park good place to relax.

fabulous art collection. It's really important to book ahead for entry, we allowed about 3 days but still only just squeezed in ! You can't just turn up, must have a booking and also you only get two hours, we allowed an hour for each floor and just about got round it all, especially as they started turfing us out 10 minutes early. If we'd been allowed more time, could easily have stayed longer. However, that said, this is a wonderful collection of paintings and sculpture - stunning Bernini statues, artwork by Raphael and Caravaggio amongst others. A must for any art lover. And when you leave the gallery, there are the lovely Borghese Gardens to wander round.

Beautiful Grounds. The grounds and gardens of the museum are incredibly beautiful! I can see how people could spend an entire day in the gallery however, it wasn't for us. But if you love art galleries, this is for you!

Amazing!!!!!!. What an amazing museum full of breathtaking statues and paintings. We are so glad we decided to make a stop here. I would definitely recommend purchasing the audio guide. We bought one for our entire family of 6 and were very happy. We listened to almost everything and we were done with the museum in about 1 hr 45 mins. Don't miss this beauty!1!

Breathtaking!. Second time at the Borghese Gallery, still just as breathtaking. The Rape of Persephone is the most beautiful statue I have ever seen (with exception of The David in Florence). The Carvaggio paintings are wonderful as well. My husband isn't an art guy at all and even he enjoyed the highlights of the museum.

Buy tickets ahead!. I wish I had known that. We walked 2 miles to get there only to find you had to book in advance because tickets were sold out. Make sure you book ahead. The park is beautiful, but it sure would have been nice to know that. It didn't say anything about must book ahead online.

Park life. Spent a wonderful afternoon in Villa Borghese and really should of made more time, a full day would of been more like it. Fabulous park museum, modern art gallery, zoo, boating lake and lots of lovely park to wander round. There's bike, ( for 2 or family ones ) segways even little motorised buggies replica of the globe theatre was great to escape the hustle an bussle of city centre though loved that to. Go enjoy.

Can't get in unless you buy tickets in advance. When you travel to Rome, most do not naturally check if every museum is open or sold out. Museum of Borghese is an essential part of a historic trip to Rome. But you need to know in advance to buy your ticket otherwise you are out of luck. This is not about skip-the-line gig. Clearly, museum management does not care about people traveling long distances to come here. I have to talk to a few people on some other topic, I can't believe how many people with bad personalities they employ there. Very surprising way to attach people. After getting to know some these people at Borghese, you start seeing parallels T some other museums.
Impressive!. This place is one of the most beautiful galeries we ever saw, unique sculpture collection, ceiling painting make you breathless!If you visit Rome - this place is must visit

Magnificent. Not to be missed. Close up and personal experience with the most incredible sculpture. Not to be missed. Spend 90 minutes of your allotted two hors on the first floor. Audio guide is excellent.

Absolutely stunning gallery!. We booked out tickets online! A must. We had a 2 hour timed entry. It was chaotic at the start as everyone has to hand in all their bags. I would recommend going in a bit after the entry time to avoid stress. An audio guide is essential as there is not much explanation about the art. The rooms, art and statues are absolutely wonderful. A must and also a pleasant walk through the gardens to the museum.
Wonderful Gallery and Park. Wonderful park and the Gallery is excellent. You must make reservations as entrance is limited. The art work is comparable to that of the Vatican.

BEST GALLERY IN ROM. Well designed, small, manageable in a reasonable amount of time yet packed with amazing art. Excellent audio guide presented just the right amount of information. Outstanding. Fortunately we knew to reserve a time in advance. I can imagine many negative reviews judging by the people who showed up waited in line only to find that they could not get in because the gallery was sold out for the day. Warning! Book in advance.
A non-visit. Arrived to learn that pre-booking is essential, and that they are fully booked for tours in two hour slots four times per day for the next 10 days. We are here for a week, so tough luck!
Best museum. The sculptures were amazing! Even if you're not into spending hours at a museum this one will capture your attention. A must do for anyone in Rome.

Stunning. The Borghese Gallery contains such stunning art work - paintings and statues. The audio guide took a little while for the three of us to figure out, but once we did was very helpful and informative. We booked through Viator thinking we would "skip the line" - not so on this tour and we had no private guide. I would recommend just buying your ticket directly from Borghese Gallery. I believe this is a must see in Rome. The artwork and presentation is truly stunning.
A must if you are in Rome. Please book ahead as it difficult to get a booking at short notice. Amazing pieces of roman art by very famous artists.

The city of ancient art. Like my title says you can see art every where in Rome, this villa is just another example, for me it was a big strange to see those haft statues but for art lovers it might be fine. Not exactly top location in Rome but if you plan a long trip it might worth it.

A must see for art lovers. If the amazing sculptures here aren't enough, the rooms of the villa itself will astound you. Reservations are necessary, but the numbers of people allowed in at once is well handled, so you are truly able to view all the sculptures from all angles and pretty much at your leisure. Plan enough time to arrive on time for your reservation, as there is a bit of a walk through the grounds to get to the villa, but it's a lovely walk.

Book ahead. It is easy to book ahead, you need to in order to avoid the queues. It is a bit of way out but if you are interested in art well worth the trip, certainly a highlight of our visit to Rome.

Jaw Dropping. This place is more amazing then the Vatican, The artworks are beyond compare and every room is lavishly decorated with the finest marbles and mosaics. The entrance hall made my jaw drop in awe.

Exhausting but worth it.. O.K. The Borghese was very crowded and the only place to sit down most of the time was on the steps (I am slightly disabled), but it was worth the pain!The paintings are of the highest quality (look out for the Caravaggios) and the sculptures to die for. Bernini's Apollo e Dafne has to be, for me, one of the all time great secular sculptures of all time. be aware though, that you have to give up your bags before going in, and that the crowds are truly awful, even in the so-called "low" season.
Lovely best Rome art museum. This had everything. Beautiful art, gardens and a little cafe. You must make reservations but it's worth the extra time.

Well worth it!. With reserved access and time limit for the visit, the numbers of visitors inside are such that there are no crowds and easy access to view all pieces. Beautiful art and sculptures. Beautiful rooms. One of the best museums we visited! Would definitely return.

Classic museum fallen on hars times. The 17th century villa houses a collection of glorious sculpture and paintng, including many famous masterpiecs, from antiquity through the 18th century. However, the glorious decor, designed for natural light, has been partly spoiled by closed shutters and harsh spotlights. The entry is now timed, by reservation, through an unattractive modern area in the basement rather that through the original entrance portico.
Fantastic for art lovers, a bit samey for anyone else. It wasn't really our "cup of tea" as we are not really big art fans but it is a must see for anyone who is

Borghese Gallery. If you love looking at sculpture and painting this is the place for you . It has to be one of the best art galleries I have ever been in it truly is breath taking When you visit there are only certain times that you can go around so it is worth finding out the times of each tour otherwise you could be waiting some time , if it is a fine day the grounds are worth a look round and there is a train that will take you around the gardens .

Bernini statues are amazing.. Must book in advance! Tickets are limited, entrants have just two hours inside. There is a lot to see but the limited entry does make the rooms seem spacious and uncrowded, unlike the Vatican museum.

Make sure that you book, or miss out!!. If you love art and sculpture, then this is the place to see! Make sure that you prebook because you can't get in any other way! Tickets are well booked up early, so pick a date and get booking! You will have to leave your bags at their storage point as you are not allowed to take them in and no flash photography. Weekends are busiest, so go in the week if you can and you only get 2 hours inside, so view at a pace!

Breathtaking!. I've been to Rome many times, and like most tourists, I kept ending up with the crowds at all the typical sites. It was only my visit, six years ago, that I changed things up a bit, and made advance reservations to visit this gem. I returned this Spring. Once again, it took my breath away. Because only a limited number of people are allowed in the gallery, through advance reservations, you're able to fully enjoy the beautiful sculptures and paintings, which are impeccably presented. And when you're done? Take a stroll through the beautiful Borghese gardens--a great way to inducement to get the kids through the gallery.

Utmost Rude Staff. We had pre poked tickets for 11am. Our flight was delayed and we we got to the museum at 10:45am to pick up our tickets. The ticket counter staff was extremely rude saying that we had to be there at 10:15, our tickets were given away, etc. He didn't even try to key in our booking code or give us other options. Then, he asked us to step out of line because we had no tickets! When I was putting things back into my pockets he threatened to call the police because I was "refusing to leave the line". There was literally only one small group behind us and I was putting my things away because this rude person denied us our timed entry. At that point I did actually refuse to leave the line and became incessant, calling his bluff. This guy was the rudest staff I have ever met and doesn't deserve a job. So, even though I booked tickets well in advance we never saw the Borghese Gallery because they refused our entrance due to our flight delay.
yes go and see it. call and make reservations before you leave and check the free dates. call quick because they book months in advance
Must See. The best of Bernini sculpture plus some great paintings and spectacular rooms. Walk straight out the door through Borghese Park and find an impressive view of Rome from above Piazza Popolo

A gallery of amazing art. My husband and I pre-booked the tickets on galleriaborghese.it months in advance. They do run out of tickets due to their increasing popularity so it is recommended that you pre-book. Upon arrival, we dropped off our bags at the bag collection booth. Remember to put everything you bring along-water, hats, camera bag and wallet in the bag. We also purchased the head set that provides a detailed overview of the art on display. For art laymen such as ourselves, we highly benefitted from that purchase. The museum tour takes 2 hours and is concise enough that it doesn't overwhelm you with art, unlike the capitaloni Museum which will take you at least 2 days to complete. This museum displays art by Bernini (master of baroque), Caravvagio and Raphael (the masters of canvas) and lovely mosaics on the floor from the Roman era. After you complete the trip, do spend some time in the garden- loved by the locals and tourists alike. You can plan a picnic and make a day of your trip to the gallery.

Joy of Rome and Francesca provided a superb tour here. Joy of Rome and Francesca provided a superb tour for my wife and I last week. She was very personal and friendly and made us feel like a good friend was talking with us. She was VERY knowledgeable and passionate about what she was sharing.What was particularly great was how she went into each room and rather than overwhelm you with details, she focused in on several key pieces that really captured the essence of the room and the gallery. We would love to book another tour with Francesca and Joy of Rome

A must visit for all the Bernini lovers!. Every time I visit Rome I come here to admire the Bernini sculptures. The precision and liveliness, Bernini was/is a true genius! Best to book tickets in advance

Must see!. The Borghese Gallery is located in a lovely park - great oxygen in the middle of a busy city. The contents of the Borghese Gallery are amazing. The sculptures and the paintings are incredible. I also appreciated the audio tour available for 5 euros
Bernini excellence. This lovely museum is not overcrowded and contains the most amazing sculptures. Book ahead, it's worth a visir

Spectacular. This is among my favorite art museums in the world. The art it contains particularly appeals to me, but it also is well managed to keep crowds in control. Added to the art is the fine setting, a little peaceful oasis in Rome.
Wonderful museum in Rome. I quite heard about review of this museum. But in my mind, this is the place of wonderful scupture and painting in Rome.
Great. One of the most beautiful museums in Italy,Very Beautiful , Your trip to Rome Won't complete without visit the Borghese Gallery

Absolutely exquisite museum. The Borghese Gallery is exquisite in every respect and well worth the time and price of admission. It is located in a park located on one of the hills of Rome and has a gorgeous garden setting. The gallery itself is decorated with sumptuous frescoes and drips with marble and baroque details. The artwork housed within the gallery is an astounding collection of paintings,sculptures and mosaics. The highlight of this collection are several astonishingly beautifully baroque marble sculpture masterpieces by Gian Lorenzo Bernini; specifically "Pluto and Persephone" which magically appears to transform hard marble into yielding flesh," David" (not to be confused with Michelangelo's David, and "Apollo and Daphne"; a work of such skill and delicacy it takes one's breath away. Be advised, ticket reservations are a must. This museum only allow 200 visitors per time slot and thus is sold out days (or even weeks In the high season)in advance. Also, one is limited to a two hour visit until the next shift of visitors arrive.
A Musuem like no other. Peaceful Landscaping, interesting museum with a big amount of statues and paintings. the entrance is expensive but its worth every penny

Beautiful Museum. While this museum was quite beautiful, it wasn't as expansive as we were expecting. We did enjoy the current Caravaggio exhibit though. Be aware that you need to book in advance and that your time is limited to two hours in the gallery. We almost enjoyed the surrounding gardens more than the actual gallery.

if you have time to visit only one, then surely its this museum. A must see museum for anyone visiting Rome and is interested in the old masters. Bernini and Caravaglio are the highlights but there are many others worth seeing in this villa turned museum with lovely grounds that are great to wander in and enjoy a leisurely picnic lunch.A word of advice, buy tickets in advance and also book visit as this museum requires a reservation , they allow small groups in at a time and this adds to the pleasure of viewing the paintings and sculptures in particular.Our entry was free as we had chosen this as one of the options for free entry that was offered when we purchased our Roma Pass.
Amazing!. What a luxuriance. Some of the paintings are almost unreal. The colours are kept so well. incredible.Must see!Buy tickets before! Only a certain amount of people are allowed to go in.
Fabulous museum.. Must get a guide to give you true appreciation for the art and the owner. Be sure to spend time with the marble piece that appears human and turns into a tree.
GEM of a Museum. If you like Bernini (and who doesn't) and Caravaglio, this Villa-turned-Museum is a must see! You have to buy tickets ahead of time - so plan ahead. We really enjoyed this visit.

Amazing Collection Housed in Beautiful Setting. Great collection of works by artists such as Bernini, Caravaggio, Rafael, and Titian. The palace itself was also a treat. The grounds were beautiful and great for a stroll. You can spend a good 2-3 hours here between the gallery and the grounds. There are a set number people that can browse the gallery during a set time frame so I would definitely recommend getting tickets ahead. You will not be let in until the time on your ticket but get there early so you can store your belongings.
Great Gallery / Very interesting story. Bring a guide if you can. The story and the art is fantastic. The park is beautiful. Purchase tickets in advance.

Borghese Gallery a must visit. The important think to know is you must order tickets in advance for a timed-two hour only visit--we had our tickets two weeks in advance and when we arrived the following week was their first opening-Rick Steve's book has good information about the visit we did not feel the need to purchase their guide--you have to leave all your belongings including purses-a safety measure-it was fine.
Amazing. If you like renassiance art this is unbelivable. You only get 2 hours. If you use the audio guides they just get you around in the time allowed.

Beautiful art everywhere!. Make sure you order tickets a few days ahead! The building and art are incredible--so much to see and look at. However, we must have gone on a super busy day (Saturday from 5-7 pm) because the rooms were packed with people and made it quite difficult to look at anything. I would probably suggest going on a different day and time slot.
what a great palace. We had a great time there. We booked online our tickets. A lot of people but the gardens around and all the inside palace...just wonderful.
Jaw-Droopingly beautiful art!. The Bernini sculptures alone make it worthwhile. If you do only one museum while in Rome, this should be the one.

They know they are good. Well when you know you are good, you don't need to be nice, or that's the impression I get anyway. We got there early in order to check our bag (ALL bags must be checked in, even small purses) and get a drink in the cafeteria. With the exception of one of the bag checkers, who was very friendly, all the staff were either downright rude or just plain cold and unfriendly. Not a good start to the experience. But once inside, the art made up for the staff. Such magnificent pieces! The statues are outstanding, and don't miss the upstairs gallery, with beautiful paintings. I think the staff could avoid half the "trouble" of having to interact with people if they more clearly stated the routine, i.e. better signage about checking in the bags and what is allowed inside. The ratty sign on the wall shows that you are not to bring in cameras and phones, but this is not true.
Amazing place, Must see. This place is amazing. The amount of the art collection and the construction of the palace is like no other.

Guided tour in English . You need to order your visit in advance, at least three or four days beforehand and for the busy times even a week is recommended. We took the guided tour which consisted of around 15 people. The audio guides are OK but a guided tour has certainly an added value, and the galleria itself with its beautiful rooms , choice selection of paintings and magnificent not to be missed statues by Bernini is a must when in Rome.

Stunned!. You wull have some work to make reservation an come exactly on tome, but it is all worth it. You have some serious works of art to see there, and to experience enterior of someones home from another era (someone was important person, but do the homework) Must be seen!

Beautiful art, poor service. I loved the precious works of art, especially the wonderful Bergini sculptures which were displayed to show their full glory. The audio guide was also very comprehensive, informative and easy to use. Unfortunately the experience was spoilt slightly by the attitude of the staff in the ticket and service area, particularly in the cafe where the staff were rude, ignorant and unhelpful. The cashier was unsmiling, disorganised, and more concerned with her mobile phone and playing with her hair than the needs of her customers. The staff generally seemed to treat the public more like cash cows than guests. It's nice to be nice. Smile, and respect your guests who are paying your wages.

The guided tour is definitely worth it. We went to this beautiful little gallery today for the 11:00-13:00 slot (your ticket allows you entry for 2hrs only so the place doesn't overcrowd like other galleries - much nicer!) and also booked in for a guided tour in English when reserving everything online. I had to book at least 8-9 days in advance for a guided tour to be available, so keep this in mind for planning ahead. Yes it cost about ~5-10 euros more but it was definitely worth it. The guide was clearly an academic who had not only studied these artists and artworks in depth but also had a genuine passion for them, and having him explain the different aspects of the works and the circumstances surrounding their composition made this one of my best art gallery experiences ever. If you're going to 'splurge' on a guided tour in only one art gallery in Rome, do it in this one. This gallery is like walking into the Uffizi and having someone tell you "we've put all the best stuff in the first 6 rooms, so go to them first" - a small gallery, but floor to ceiling packed with masterpieces. Do yourself a favour and go here when you're in Rome!

Cool. A must do with a guide to get a lot more context about the special pieces. Beautiful. It's a little confusing meeting up with the guide but be sure to get in line for an audio player and then you get the sticker to wear and the earpiece to hear with.

See how Michelangelo's David inspired Bernini!. I strongly recommend seeing this museum as it holds a large collection of sculptures done by Bernini. Bernini's work clearly was inspired by the detail and anatomy of Michelangelo's David, but he evolves it even further with sculptures in movement. You will also appreciate a waxy look the marble is given that creates life-like "flesh". The sculptures are truly amazing. There are also portraits done by the famous painter, Caravaggio, but I think the Bernini art is the highlight. Note: Be on time for your ticke time as they are allot only 2 hours for your tour.
excellent. book your tickets in advance. get there half an hour before the tour. go off-season for ultimate sensation. enjoy!

I can't believe some people skip this place!. This gallery has amazing pieces by Bernini, Caravaggio and others, besides being an astounding building. They only allow 200 people in every 2 hours, and you must pre-book you day and time of attendance. It's totally worth it.Also, spend a few euro and get the audio-guide. The explanations help you enjoy the artpieces even more. My favorite was the Daphne statue - the way the audio guide told me to move around it and observe made this beautiful marble something sublime.According to many Romans, many tourists skip this place and stay on a Colosseum-Vatican-Shopping 3 day itinerary. Don't be like them and find time to go to this Gallery!

Villa Borghese. We visited for just short of two hours, on Easter Monday, having booked about two weeks in advance - this was essential as by Monday they had sold out until Thursday. The 63 bus stops very close by. Gallery has reasonable shop and small cafe and rather basic loos, but you go for quite the most stunning small collection of Renaisance painting and sculpture, inside a beautiful (smallish) building with the most amazing interiors, stupendous amounts of marble and Roman mosaics. Unmissable.

Exquisite Sculpture Gallery in a Palace. The sculptures are just amazing-gorgeous, some huge, some small, all interesting portraying life in Rome during a grand period. The palace itself is a work of art and the works of art totally memorable. Well worthwhile to visit
Must see. For Bernini lovers, must see. rivals the fountains and Vatican columns in Bernini's sculpture. Recommend highly.
Go!. Book online before you leave. Show up on time and take in all that the museum has to offer. Super cool gallery.

Must visit. Definitely worth to visit when in Rome. A bit overorganized – strictly scheduled visiting and online booking only. But it helps to avoid crowd. Small museum – 2 hours well enough. Rich variety of paintings, sculptures, furniture all at the authentic palace.

Incredible sculpture; you must book tickets in advance. The Borghese Gallery contains an outstanding sculpture collection, especially the pieces by Bernini, and is housed in the former Villa Borghese, worth seeing on its own for the amazing decorations. The audio guide (not included in the ticket price but worth the additional cost) does a great job of providing historical context and helping you better appreciate the art. After the Vatican and the Colosseum, this was one of our favorite sites in Rome. You must book tickets in advance; make sure you use the official site so you don't pay any unnecessary additional fees through third party sites. Tickets are 11 Euros per adult (plus 5 Euros for the audioguide, which you can't purchase in advance). You book for a two-hour time slot and cannot stay any longer, so budget your time inside carefully. All bags, purses, and umbrellas must be checked, regardless of size, but you can take photos without flash, so you can keep your camera and cellphone. If you want to rent an audioguide, make sure you keep a drivers license that you can give them in exchange (they won't accept a passport).

Stunning! Awe-inspiring!. The Borghese Gallery was beautiful, awe-inspiring. There are no words to describe the sculpture, mosaics, paintings. This is a must-see in Rome, so be sure to order your tickets early by calling the reservation number. We were so glad to have found a review that told us to do that. Many people were offering money by the gate to get tickets because they did not plan ahead. Be sure to plan a walk through the garden afterward. We ate in the small cafeteria afterward and though crowded, the food was okay. Arrive early, the lines get long for coat and bag check as the time gets closer. The first floor rooms are large so the order you enter doesn't mean much. I know some travel to the second floor with the paintings, etc. first to avoid the crowds, but be sure to leave time for the first, as it was my favorite, and the audio tour sets are a must if you want to understand anything you see. If you walk, the gardens are close to the Marriott in Rome, the gallery at the furthest end. Enjoy. I think this may have been my favorite site in Rome.

Amazing. A truly wonderful gallery with awe-inspiring works of art. We had a fantastic guide who brought the exhibits to life with her detailed knowledge and enthusiastic storytelling. We were totally blown away and moved to tears at times. One of the highlights of our Rome trip.
"Beautiful gallery" - must watch . Marvellous work of art , beautiful sculptures. Don't miss it while visiting rome. You have to prebook tickets online. Usually closed on Monday.
Beautiful place. It was one of the first places visited, but remained as the most beautiful museum I have ever seen. It is located in a beautiful and quiet park, in the middle of town.

Amazing art housed inside a work of art. Reserve tickets in advance, but be prepared for a rather unpleasant check-in, mandatory bag check and subway-car crowded entrance scrum. Might avoid some of this if you arrive later in the half-hour entry period. However, the gallery is fantastic, especially the sculpture. Well worth the trek to a slightly outlying part of the city.

One of the best worldwide... and just unparalleled!. ...art treasury that houses a unique collection of sculptures of Bernini along with a few works of Titian, Rubens and Caravaggio. The garden around the villa Borghese are worth a visit per se. Don't miss going there by booking tickets (guided tour) well in advance, this is a breathtaking jewel of Italian art and a unique visitor experience...

Very interesting. It is a must to visit here even if you are not in particular art fan.
Two hours are more than enought to get the atmosphere and enjoy the exhibits.
Highly recommended

Fantastic gallery but surly staff!. This is an amazing place and a must to visit as the artwork is outstanding! It's a shame it's let down by surly staff. You have to pre book and then collect your tickets on the day but be prepared to wait as there was a very long queue and only one person serving...a gentleman who was most unwelcoming. I would advise not to take any bags with you as they have to be handed in...another lengthy queue awaited us with the most rude and surly lady on the desk I have ever encountered. She was so unpleasant I actually found it amusing! If they changed their staff or maybe even re trained them it would be a far more pleasant experience as the gallery really deserves to have people who are proud to work there!
beautiful. Amazing Villa/Museum gorgeous would recommend to anyone unfortunately the drawback is it's very, very small.
Very nice. Very nice fine art, one of the finest arts I ever seen, it have a nice park around it which was a good place to walk in after the 2-hour visit museum.

Wonderful museum . The Borghese gallery is a small treasure in the heart of Rome. It contains some of the best sculpture by Canova and Bernini you will see anywhere in the world and as such can not be missed. As a small gallery it's a welcome change from the Vatican museums such that you can comfortably go round in an hour and see everything there is to see while not being crowded out at any point. Only key point to remember is you have to book tickets to go in at allotted times.
Caravaggio alone make this worthwhile; must book online ahead. Some of the best art in Rome, 25min walk to Modern Art Museum and or Villa Giulia Etruscan art through park. BOOK ONLINE in advance.

Lives Up to the Hype: Good & Bad. To say that this is a place with a reputation would be an understatement... a set list of beautiful and unparalleled artwork, accompanied by a laundry list of rules and gruff staff willing to enforce them.Superlatives abound about the art, rightly so...so I won't bother (not that I couldn't!) The art is beautiful, and the reason for being there. EVERYONE wants their own pics and are courteous to those around them to get them; but some major pieces have some lighting issues, namely, harshly bright in some places. It's a quibble... I didn't come away with any pictures that didn't have beautiful things in them.The notoriously gruff staff are another story. Suffice to say that I am in the midst of a formal letter of complaint to those in charge. Let's just say that some of the front line staff "don't play nice" and are setting their sights on reinventing what rude really means.All of the art, however, was fantastic!

Reserved My Ticket/Time in advance, and, as required for entry.. Simply stunning. A revisit for me. Much to see but doable within the 2 hour required visit. Sorry that there was no coffee shop after all the stairs to climb to see it all. Would not have missed a bit of it, again, though.

Why does this wonderful gallery employ such awful staff ??. The artwork, building and sculptures are fantastic. The collection really is a wonder to behold. So why ruin the experience with rude, arrogant staff? EVERY single person we spoke to from ticket desk to bag check and gallery attendant to cafeteria assistant was surly, obnoxious and miserable. It got so bad we ended up laughing at their temperaments. What a shame when this is such a beautiful place. It's about time the employers read some of the comments and did some customer training or recruitment new staff!

Marvellous Art Gallery . This is a little museum with some of the most beautiful artworks in art history.You have to book ahead because they only let a limited number of people enter the gallery in turns of two hours. When we arrived there at 8.30h the tickets fot that day were sold out. And the museum opened at 9.00h.It is very beautiful but as you can only stay there for two hours, you have to administrate your time. The surroundings are also very beautiful.

Beautiful Borghese. Inside and out, the Borghese was beautiful. We toured on a lovely sunny day. The gardens and adjoining park were starting to bloom. Inside, the painting s and sculptures were outstanding. Suggest you buy tickets online and use headphones. Only 2 hours to see it all but worth every minute.
Almost didn't go. We had a great guide. She was passionate about the museum and the works. Glad we went. The grounds are also fun to walk around. I do recommend the guide at the Gallery.
It is a must, if you are longer than 3 days in Rome. Unique art collection. Many people travel to Italy especially to see it.Note, the tickets must be bought ahead in the Net. No other way to get in.

Book ahead!. We had a terrific tour of this museum last Sunday. Had trouble booking online because the secure website wouldn't accept my credit card info. My wife called the museum booking office directly and we were able to book an 11 am tour with an English speaking guide. There is so much to see that we would have missed a great deal without the guide. The sculpture and art work is stunning. Fortunately, they restrict the number of entrants, and the length of visits, so one has time and space to truly appreciate the masterpieces. This museum was one of the highlights of our Rome visit.

This is a top bucket list item.. This is an incredible sculpture, art and architectural site. The contents are so impressive, containing such great sculptures, art, ceiling art and decorations, words can hardly describe. This location along with Muse Capitolini and Vatican Museum are the best art museums in Rome area.
Enjoyed this place very much!. For art lovers - definitely recommend to visit! You will enjoy this place and won't be disappointed!

a nice park and villa. villas and gallery in the middle of a huge park make sure to book in advance for the entrance of the gallery cuz sometimes it s kind of fully booked so to avoid waiting make sure to book in advanced anyway it s nice to have a walk in the park outside and relax from a long day walking in rome w relaxing place and picturesque

Book ahead and go!. After putting off going for too long, my sister and I managed to book tickets and loved our 2-hour escape into the Gallery. We used the tour in a Rick Steves guidebook and made our way through at a hearty pace. We're no experts but we loved the sculptures, space, and history. Highly recommend.

The best ratio of masterpieces per square meter in the world. Maybe Galleria Borghese has the best ratio of masterpieces by area in the world.
Has you have to book in advance, try to go in the first hours of the day, so vou can walk freely through lhe rooms

Go if you're a big fan of Bernini and Carravagio. You must reserve a ticket at least a day in advance; it's easiest to book online. The 2 hour visit is more than adequate to see everything. Bernini's sculpture Apollo and Daphne is the centerpiece of one room; spend time there.

Disappointing!. After seeing it on a TV programme we expected to see beautiful villa surrounded by wonderful Italian gardens. Not so! The typical Italian garden containing statuary occupied a small fraction of the acres of scrubby parkland. Entrance to the Villa museum was by timed ticket, in two hour periods. 9-11 11-1 1-3 etc., there’s only one small (crowded) cafe & shop near the museum so make sure you time your arrival for just before the chosen time period otherwise you’ll have a long wait.

The beauty of art and the beauty of nature all in one trip. The Borghese Gallery is in the Villa Borghese gardens, so if you visit make sure you have plenty of time to wander around in the gardens before or after your visit. We took a guided tour which we internet pre-booked and the tour took around 90 minutes. We had a lovely guide (not sure of her name but it could be Dr Maria something). She is obviously a big fan of the sculptor Bernini, and her enthusiasm was infectious, she went into great detail about the pieces on display, which are stunning, and the information she gave us really made the whole tour a delight. So i definitely recommend a guided tour. The highlight of our visit were the Bernini sculptures, but there are also some wonderful Caravaggio paintings which are also a highlight.And to top off a lovely visit, we then spent a couple of hours in the gardens, enjoying the sun.

A MUST SEE for Rome.. It is too easy to travel to Rome and not walk up the hill to visit the Borghese Gardens and it's magnificent Gallery. You really should though as this building contains a cornucopia of marble statues and antiquities which are a marvel. Come up to Villa Borghese for the shady spots under the trees and get away from the packed streets of the more visited spots in the city centre.

Best museum in Rome. Great museum with outstanding sculptures and paintings. Beautiful rooms with fresco painting on ceiling. This museum is not too large so it is not overwhelming as the Vatican museum is. Only two floors make it great. Plenty of detail, but can be covered in 2 hours. Nice surrounding grounds make a great place for a stroll.

Breathtaking Bernini sculptures and other priceless treasures. This is 'the icing on the cake' of all the art treasures in Rome, second only to the Vatican Museums. The excellent audio-guide is a must to get the most out of the strict two-hour time limit and to hear some of the stories behind the collection. The booking process is annoying but does ensure that crowds are kept to a manageable level. The only negative aspect of the visit was the rudeness and arrogance of the staff, from the ticket office to the audio-guide desk, to the cafeteria! Definitely a must-see, if only to gaze on the genius of Bernini's beautiful sculptures. Make sure you spend some time in the parkland surrounding the Gallery while you are there. We counted 11 different ways of getting around the park while we were 'people-watching' on a perfect spring Saturday, including hired bicycles, pedal cars and segways.
A must!!!!. Make your reservations early. This is a must see attraction in Rome. Phenomenal art in a great park setting. After seeing the gallery, stroll the gardens.

Wonderful. Beautiful setting, reservations for a fee but still a must see. The Gallery charges a fee for admission but the outside grounds and sites are free - grounds cover a very large area with many statues and buildings.
Best. One of The nicest experiece in Rome.The Borghese Garden is amazing.Renting a boat for 20 min is 3 euros..amazing adventure for couples but also with kids

Wonderful accessiblly sized collection of art. Very intersting collection including a few very well known Carravagios and some even better paintings (!) by his comtempories, but better than all that the AMAZING Bernini Statues of David, Anaeus and Daphne and Apollo - worth visiting rome for!

Exquisite art. This museum has some of the most incredible paintings and sculptures I have seen in one fairly small place. We took a tour, which I highly recommend, and which is reviewed elsewhere. The only odd thing was that after two hours our time was up and the entire group was told to leave. Apparently they don't want people to linger, and literally kick them out after the time limit.

A treasure trove of masterpieces. This is an outstanding museum experience. A guide is strongly recommended as visitors are limited to 2 hours and there is so much to see. Luca, with Viator, was fantastic - informative and lively. The sculptures by Bernini and paintings by Cavaggio were the highlights of the visit.
Amazing collection of art. Art is amazing, personal favourite are the Bernini sculptures.. Absolutely beautiful. Staff are rude and not helpful overall.
visit if you like art. a lot of famouse paintings in there. you need around 1 hour to check it. really beautyfull and worth checking

An amazing museum.... I visited Galleria Borghese 3 years ago because i was studuying in Italy and I needed to know everything about it. The Caraggio´s are fabulous. I love arts, so I really reccomend that place.

You have to really want to go. The gardens are lovely, truly worth a stroll. The museum is booked days in advance and the staff are incredibly rude. The only place in all of Italy I experienced such behavior. Go if you really want to see something in particular but plan way ahead, don't expect to get in if you just show up. With all of the wonderful art in Rome and surrounding Italy, this place is not worth all the planning it takes to get in or the extra tour booking you would have to make.

Massive. When you visit this place it is like a stately home with grounds and galleries spread around everywhere, they do hire golf carts bikes or go carts etc... to get around, you will need a full day to visit

Get tickets in advance . This is a must see in Rome. You must order your tickets in advance. When we got there they were sold out for the next two days. Thank goodness I already had some. We didn't do a private tour or the headsets and we were fine. Beautiful ceilings. I would not being children under 13. Lots of nudity.

Lots and lots of Art. Great art gallery with Bernini's most famous work. The second floor is all paintings, alot of paintings. If your into art you must visit this gallery. You pay for a 2 hour time slot just enough time for me.

Beautiful sculptures. We had Roma Passes and I call for reservation at 9:30 at the morning. First person hung up... called again and I got the reservation done for the sama day. We had to pick up the tickets 45 minutes before our reserved time (15 p.m.). There was a lot to see and there was also cafeteria at the building. You must to leave all bags (hand bags also) in the 'cloakroom'.

Breathtaking.... I had expected to see just another museum, but it was simply breathtaking! The fully decorated rooms, painted ceilings and all the pictures and unbelievable Bernini statues form an unique piece of art in themselves! The two hours tick away without noticing. You can stroll through the rooms and check all the mythological sceneries, read through the background stories or just hear what the other visitors are guessing to watch there :). Some knowledge about Greek/Roman myths is definitely helpful to make it to an unforgettable experience! Do not forget to book in advance. It is it possible to walk in without online reservation!!!

Loved it. Recommended by friend of a friend. Organized member of party booked a tour guide who was absolutely brilliant - made the collection come alive for us. When next in Rome will go again and try cycling through the park etc.

an incredibly swift visit on our last evening!. We only had 1 1/2 hrs of our trip to whizz around and see the sights.You have to phone and book to visit here.The sculptures were amazing and absolutely beautifully presented in exquisitely decorated rooms.You must see Bernini's works, they will make you cry with delight!The Rape of Proserpina, (look at the hand on Proserpina's thigh! How realistic),Apollo and Daphne ( with Daphne transforming into a tree), and Aeneas, Anchises, and Ascanius, which Bernini is said to have done when he was 16years old!
Must see!. The best gallery in Rome if one likes Bernini and Caravaggio. Focus on the first floor. The park around is also beautiful.

A nice way to spend an hour. You have to book at least a week in advance, which we didn't know, so we came back a few days later and found out you're only allowed to stay inside for two hours. The museum itself is pretty, but the signs for the pictures and statues are kind of confusing in the way they're set up. I had trouble matching the signs with their respective artwork, especially since I don't speak Italian. It took about an hour to see it all. Overall, a nice stop on the way to the zoo just down the street (THAT is a fun way to spend a morning!)

Best small museum. Very worth while. Great rooms with great paintings and sculptures. Don't forget to book in advance, normally you won't get tickets for the same day. Only got to see the gallery on my 2nd time in Rome. The price is not high and you'll get 2 hours to see it, once the time is up the museum is cleared for the next group, so try to have a good speed to see everything.

Try to allow some time to enjoy the beautiful park while you're there. After viewing the interior artwork, walk around the building exterior and enjoy the grounds. Allow some time to stroll in the large park surrounding the museum. Consider renting a surrey bicycle. This museum houses some of the most famous sculpture and paintings in the world.
So much glitz. Well worth the time slot. All most not enough time. Restaurant good as well. Beautiful paintings and building even the fireplaces were works of art.

The scupture is unbelievable. This is well worth the time and effort to enjoy. You must prebook and are given an entrance time and a limit of 2 hours. The entrance and main floor of the gallery will take nearly that long as every piece of sculpture is very interesting. Bernini and Canova created most of the works and the signage is very good. The 2nd floor is pictures and is interesting but not nearly as interesting to me. We travelled by bus from Termini Station and returned by taxi as the return journey by bus wasn't nearly as straight forward.

You must go if you have time. Is a little bit far from the Center of Rome, but if you like paintings you must not miss this place, be sure to book in advance because the waiting line is of about 2 weeks. If you know less than John Snow in painting, then skip this place.
Breathtaking!!!. The beauty of the art work here is amazing, I could easily call this one of the jewels of Rome, not to be missed!!
One of world's best museums. Beautiful museum, lot's of art that belong to world's best, made by the world's greatest. Worth the money.

A window into Rome of the past - the good, the bad and the ugly. As I walked through the gallery, I was cognizant that I was walking through the history of Rome, the Church, art and all of Europe. The Borghese Gallery is more than a collection of artworks - it is an entire experience of the excesses of the wealthy and powerful, and a catalogue of the nepotism and corruption of the church, as well as a symbol of later dynasties (including Napoleon's sister).What made this gallery amazing was reading about the history of the palace as I walked through, the people who walked the corridors and lived, visited and partied in the rooms. Although many of the original works that were once housed here are now in the Louvre, their removal and replacement is itself intriguing, and part of the history of this gallery.If you're travelling to Rome for more than a day, this is not an attraction to be missed.

Wonderful art and sculptures in this museum. We reserved our spot a couple of weeks in advance by making a phone call to The gallery. We listened to the audio guide at $5 each. This helped us learn the details about key pieces. Highly recommend renting these. You need your ticket to use the restroom and your bag cannot go into the museum, but there's a coat check and they give you a bag for you to put your valuables in so you can put them in your pocket. Do this as soon as you have your ticket as if you wait the crowd is so big and chaotic. Finding the bus afterwards was our biggest snafu. After 1 1/2 hours we finally found a stop that was operating.

Ahh Bernini!. This is an amazing place, with marvelous art and sculptures. Get a reservation and go! You will have to check your backpacks, but don't let that stop you. My DH loved all the paintings, as I did, but I had trouble getting away from Bernini's sculptures. WOW!! They were all stunning but my favorite was David. Awe-inspiring and breath-taking place.

EXCELLENT EXCESS AT THE BORGHESE. The Gallery is excellent, bringing together an exceptional collection in a beautiful environment. The scale of collection is truly impressive for what is a relatively small gallery. The gardens are beautiful and well worth a little walk around. The Gallery gets booked well in advance so please do book before your visit to avoid disappointment.
this place is a must. omg what a place you must book in advance at least a week in advance you will not be disappointed this place and gardens are amazing

Enjoyable Art - even with a toddler. The Borghese Gallery is one of the few musuems in Rome that does not allow strollers. This made it a challenge with a toddler in the in between stage (too big for the Ergo, but not quite ready to hold my hand and look at art for an extended period). The gallery entrance is timed for 2 hours and the grounds are beautiful. If I had a do over, I would collect my ticket and let my little guy play in fountains for the first hour and then enter for our second hour. Most people - and more importantly, most tour groups - will have passed through by that time leaving more space for a small child to roam. The Borghese is a must see for art lovers.

So many treasures to see here. We greatly enjoyed our recent visit to the Borghese Gallery which is set in the attractive & rather grand Borghese gardens. Please be aware that it is essential to pre-book as entry numbers are restricted & strictly controlled, & it is also important to arrive on time as each visit is limited to a 2 hour slot. We found 2 hours just enough to enjoy the exhibits including many Bernini sculptures & paintings by artists including Titian, Peter Paul Rubens, & a deservedly much-celebrated collection by Caravaggio. When your 2 hours are over you are expected to leave promptly to allow the next cohort in, but there is still the café (which serves light lunches etc.) & the gift shop to enjoy.

Beautiful Museum - 2 Hour Limit. We visited this museum on a Sunday morning - we had a 9 am - 11 am slot. We arrived on time, but really only had time to see 2/3 of the museums because they are very strict on time limits. At about 10:45, they started very aggressively kicking visitors out. I understand it's a hot attraction, but the aggressive nature of the management seemed somewhat out of place. That said, the museum is truly stunning and the sculptures, paintings, and frescos are out of this world.
