The marble statues by Bernini in particular are amazingly beautiful. One needs to book beforehand for a two hour slot which are really hardly enough to admire all this beauty.

Just AMAZING!. I didn't know about this place when I was in rome first time. A friend suggested it and I have asked my guides, the Joy of Rome team, to book a tour for me and a friend. The place is really full of painting everywhere and the statues by Bernini look like they are made of real flesh! Caravaggio was my favourite thanks to Angelica explanations. I didn't know about him and it was a real discover! Don't miss this place is full of beatiful artwoks that you can see from very close. They allow only few people at the time, make sure you book in advance!
A must. Impossible to miss this. Breathtaking sculptures in one of the best palaces in Rome. Need to book in advance or you will run the risk to miss it...

Crammed with gems. Every room is full of artworks which you will recognise and some rooms have them competing with so many others.
The two-hour slot will only just be enough to get around the whole gallery, so start at the top (away from the main crowds working their way up) and work your way back down.
Don't miss this one. This is one of teh finest art destinations in the world. Truly spectacular. best done wiht a knowledgable guide unless you are a real expert in art.

Must see if you love art!!! 미술관 많지만 여긴 꼭 봐야죠!!!. OK you have to reserve by the phone if you buy Roma pass - that's what we did. You can stay just 2 hours and you will be very busy and be moved by many masterpieces in there! If you stay more than 2 days in Rome,please arrange your time to spend here!로마 패스 사면 공짜로 가지만 전화예약 해야 하지요 호텔 컨시어지에게 맡기세요 9시부터 컨시어지가 전화했지만 10분 넘게 통화 중..그만큼 찾는 사람 많고 보르게제 공원도 즐기세요. 두 시간 동안 그냥 감동의 파노라마....비수기인 1월도 사람이 꽉 차니 여름엔 어떻겠어요? 팜플렛 당연 소장해야죠 그만큼 스토리 많은 작품들이 즐비해요....

Amazing! Mouth open in awe for the two hours. There are many galleries in Rome- we only had time for one. I'm glad we chose this one. Opulence on another level- Caravaggio paintings, amazing sculptures by Bernini and never forget to look up or down- amazing ceilings and some great mosaic floors too.

Disappointing. . Whilst this gallery does house many beautiful pieces of art, Caravaggio, Botticelli and the fantastic Bernini! To name a few! I found the staff to be rude and disinterested. 2 hours is clearly not long enough, apparently they have Titian here, but we unfortunately couldn't find it as we were unceremoniously bundled out by their security. Also you are only allotted 30 minutes in the picture gallery???

Unbelieveably. Gallery is just the right size - can be viewed in and hour or so, with a fabulous collection of Carravagio paintings and the most amazing Bernini and other marble sculpturesReservation required

Bit of a pain, but worth it. Really spectacular art in a beautiful setting. There were long lines for everything, even with scheduled visits, but the crowds thinned quickly. The park it is in is lovely and a great place to walk and run.

Rome's must to see place . Gallery is located at Villa Borghese. There are carved statues and artwork in the gallery. Bellini, Raphael, Correggio, very important works by important people like the mess is also located here
only outside view. It was a disappointment that we were not able to visit , but it is impressive from the outside .Recommendation : to be made ​​in advance booking

A must visit. You MUST have a reservation to go in and are limited to two hours. The staff was exacting on the time. The first time an event started and ended on time in Rome. The statutes were some of the best I have seen in any museum in the world.

a small time travel. Need to book tickets in advance at a fixed time, so you should get to the gardens and walk in them first. There is even a nice zoo.
The gallery itself is not large; the main exhibits are on two floors.
Place wonderfully preserved and allows time travel, (about two hours), to the peak period of the Italian Renaissance.
Stunning!. We went quite late in the afternoon and found it to be quiet...it IS worth getting the audio for this one.

Your jaw will drop open in the first room and remain open throughout. This museum has the highest density of exquisite art anywhere in Rome or for that matter anywhere in the world. You have to book in advance or face a sold-out situation during your trip. They give you a two-hour window and you MUST be there on time or lose some of your allocated slot of 2 hours because once your 2 hours are up, you are booted out to make room for others wanting their share of looking at the stupendous sculptures and paintings. There is a coat check down the stairs from the street level which is also the entrance to the museum. Don't make the mistake of walking up the stairs from the street level to the open door above because you will wait for no good reason only to be told to go get your tickets from down below. This museum comes to life with the excellent audio guide which is a MUST have. Plan to arrive early so that you have time to pick up your reserved ticket, check in your oversized backpack and get the audioguide for 5 Euros (well worth it). You will have to queue up for all these activities and you are losing time if you arrive just before your 2 hour slot. Also note that public transportation to this museum by Metro involves a long walk (20 minutes total at a very fast trot uphill on Via Veneto, walking under the walls to enter the park and then turning right and walking to the museum inside the Borghese gardens). The metro stop is Barberini. There are masterpieces almost in every room of this museum. You will remember this museum for the rest of your life if you decide to visit it and plan properly.

Simply beautiful. The best antique's art gallery in Rome. Beautiful building in Beautiful Park. Fantastic masterpiece of Canova, Bernini, Tiziano and many other.Don't forget to booking your vist on line before. Every mounth The first sunday free entry
Very nice place in a very nice garden. Beautiful site, in a very nice garden. Mostly impressive for the quality of sculpture inside (also paintings bit you have there wonderful sculptures)

A must see museum. We decided to go to the Borghese Gallery after learning about a few of the sculptures that are housed there. This museum is a smaller museum which makes it possible see almost everything within the 2 hour time frame. We went on a Wednesday afternoon and we're not able to get in on the same day as tickets were sold out. They let a limited number of people in, in 2 hour times slots. This helps with crowd control and allows a more enjoyable let experience. We ended up reserving tickets for the next day for 9 am. When we cam back we picked up our audio guides for €5 each. They only accept cash for the audioguides. The audioguides were informative and enjoyable. You also must check you bags as you are not allowed to bring them in. Since we had the earliest time slot, there weren't a ton of people which made the museum more enjoyable. The audioguides walked us through the entire museum which is broken down into two levels; the first level which has all the sculptures and the second which has all the painting.I personally enjoyed the sculptures the most. The gallery holds many pieces of artwork from Bernini and Carravagio, which were amazing. At the end of your 2 hour time slot, security announces that you must leave the gallery. They start shutting down rooms and moving people out in preparation for the next group. We really enjoyed this museum and would recommend it to anyone visiting rome!

Just. Wow.. If you visit Rome you must visit the Borghese Gallery. You will need to book in advance and cannot turn up on the day to buy a ticket as you will not get in - this is to control the crowds - they have 2 hours slots that you have to book. The Galleria Borghese includes twenty rooms across two floors.The main floor is mostly devoted to classical antiquities of the 1st–3rd centuries AD (including a famous 320–30 AD mosaic of gladiators found on the Borghese estate at Torrenova, on the Via Casilina outside Rome, in 1834), and classical and neo-classical sculpture such as the Venus Victrix. Its decorative scheme includes a trompe l'oeil ceiling fresco in the first room, or Salone, by the Sicilian artist Mariano Rossi makes such good use of foreshortening that it appears almost three-dimensionalA must for anyone visiting Rome!
Highly recommended. A must see for lovers of art and architecture. The Bernini sculptures are truly impressive. Would recommend going for a stroll around the surrounding gardens.

Small, but lovely. This lovely villa on the edge of the Borghese gardens has about 20 rooms and is two stories. It is small, but has many wonderful paintings and sculptures. Be sure to get your reservations well in advance. Also, there is no early admission. The gallery is very careful to keep the attendance manageable, and makes the visit so much nicer than many other places.

Wow!. Must see! Great collection of art and history! Make sure to get audio devices to listen to explanations as you move from room to room. Audio device is absolutely worth €5 and I even got it for my 8-year-old.

Beautiful gallery,book your tickets in advance to avoid disappointment. You must visit the Borghese Gallery,even if you are only vaguely interested in art. You'll have to book well in advance of your visit to Rome. (It's possible to book online before you leave, which is recommend.) There are specific time slots given to you when you book your tickets which means the house is never too crowded.The time and price is worth it for the sculptures, and the Renaissance masterpieces by the likes of Titian and Raphael, also some Carravagio paintings.This is a must place to visit when in Rome.Also take time to stroll around the gardens.

Must Do - Top Museum. If you were only allowed one museum to visit in Rome (or by extension in the entire world) then this should be the one you should pick. Or if you were to visit several, this should be your first. The collection of top sculptures by Bernini (with Michelangelo, Canova and Rodin likely among the top 4 sculpture artists of all times) is unmatched. Every on the ground floor has one of his top works, elegantly set in richly decorated rooms, full of other artwork and delicately matched fresco's and decors. Do not forget to visit the pinacoteca on the second floor, to admire Raphael's, Rubens, Boticelli and other Renaissance and Barok masterpieces.
Not to miss!. Make sure you book tickets ahead of time to avoid disappointment. Even my kids liked it! (but we only stayed 2 hours:)

Borghese Gallery with audio. When we were there we were able to book two tickets for the two-hour tour online for € 26. Getting the available audio tour was very helpful. It helped make sure that we could see almost all of the art works. We missed a few pieces in the picture gallery. Be prepared for quite a climb to get there. It is amazing to think of the wealth that Cardinal Borghese was able to acquire to be able to accumulate the collection of incredibly beautiful works. This is a must see on a visit to Rome.

Buy your tickets way in advance.. Just the right amount of art so we didn't get overwhelmed. Look for the laminated English guide sheets. They're tucked away in each room and provide interesting info about the works.

Beautiful gallery, but terrible customer service. This was an amazing gallery to visit, very beautiful, however, the experience was bittersweet due to rude customer service from the two staff members; one of the male staff spoke aggressively to a family in front of us, which we also encountered. The female member of staff was equally rude when we tried later to enquire about the various ticket prices. If you can, keep away from the customer service desk.
Lovely. Quite lovely and well looked after. It is a great visit. I went with my parents and they loved it too.
So amazing!. Take your time to walk through this incredible gallery- don't rush it! Plan on 2-3 hours minimum is recommended. Again, plan to go as early as you can to avoid the crowds

Great pieces, Titian-lovers look here!. Great quality art collection. Reserve online first- we didn't plan ahead before flying overseas. Were still able to book via the hotel wifi while in town 1 day before. They let you book in 2 hr blocks. It's a small museum but worth the visitt for art lovers. It might be not as interesting for the casual-tourist though, as prices are expensive, and the place is pretty small.We also rented bicycle-wagons in the part so spent a couple hours in the park.
Beautiful place. It was remarkable place with a lot of masterpieces incredible famous treachery of arts, must be seen.

Not to be missed. One of the highlights of our Rome visit. Not so big as to be overwhelming, but loaded with great art and history. The sculptures alone are amazing. We had the audio tour and it was both informative about the art as well about the background. To their credit, not at all shying away from describing the usual underhanded ways much of it was acquired. Beautiful setting and hiking through the gardens afterward well worth it. Tip: easy walk to Piazza del Popolo with its ancient obelisk and open oval square, then down via del Babuino to the Spanish steps. Lots of restaurant choices along the way.

Chaotic. Tickets need to be purchased in advance with a timed entry. The day we visited (with tickets purchased well in advance) there were what seemed to be hundreds of people milling around. We stood in line to enter at the appointed time and as we got to security I was told I could not bring my handbag (normal size) in and sent to wait in another long line to check it. Back to the first line....The early rooms are so mobbed it is impossible to move. There may be treasures here but it is difficult and unpleasant to move around particularly on the ground floor. Would only recommend visiting at the most "off peak" time.

Get your tickets in advance! . Make sure you get your tickets in advance, because this is quite the popular attraction! The architecture is breathtaking. Grab an audio guide - it's got some great information about the Borghese family and the artwork you're seeing. Keep your eyes open for the stunning Bernini sculptures!

got tired when we reached up there... the journey to Borghese Gallery was long and tiring...and the exhibition in the building was just okay but not impressive. We were going with tour but should experience much better if so..

must visit. This is a museum which belonged Borghese family before they sold it to the government. There is an incredible collection of sculptures especially very very impressive Works of Bernini. You have to make a reservation preferably online if you have limited time in Rome. Spare like 1,5 hrs at least.

Have your socks blown off here. Just phenomenal. Should not be missed. The only problem is that you may feel a bit overstimulated by the time you walk out the door. Highly recommend the audio guide, or else you really won't understand what you are looking at, or how the history feeds into the collection. Amazing building, amazing artwork.
painting and sculpture of the 60ties. Religios painting painting s and sculptures of the sixties. 11 euro gate fee. One of the Turistic attraction in rome.

A must for art lovers. It surprised me the beauty of all the pieces exhibited in this museum: simply great! It's necessary to book the tickets online since the visits are limited to 360 people every two hours. You have to arrive there half an hour before your due time to pick up the tickets at the entrance and leave all your bags in the cloackroom. I'd recommend you to spend some time before or after your visit strolling around the Villa Borghese, a wonderful park with the possibility of renting a bike to move around.

Advance Tickets, Amazing Collection. You must reserve tickets prior to arrival and I'm sure most sell out each day- I bought mine 2 months in advance to make sure. We took the bus to the Borghese park but the stop we wanted wasn't clearly marked; luckily the bus driver told us where to get off. The collection inside is, of course, amazing. My guess is that with limited tickets being sold for different time slots that there is always the same general amount of visitors. We had 5pm tickets and it wasn't that crowded. Our visit lasted about 1.5hr, while taking our time.

Absolutely Gorgeous. My wife and I walked here all the way from close to the Vatican where we were staying, and not one step was wasted. This art Gallery is not to be missed, if you have to start cutting things out due to time constraints this should go on the very short list. This is truly one of the best tourist spots in town. When you get here and buy your ticket, it is only good for a couple of hours. Yeah, you may have to wait a couple of hours for your ticket time and you will only have a couple of hours to take advantage of it. This place is in that high of a demand. Luckily there`s a park and some cafes nearby.

A wonderful afternoon. We stayed close by and enjoyed the beautiful walk to the museum. Guisepe from Hotel Golden recommended it. We went at a time that was unrushed so we were also. The headsets with the information are a necessity and so worthwhile. If we had ha more time, we would have enjoyed the bicycle carraiges one can rent to see the park in detail.
Worth a visit!. We reserved tickets with an entry time of 5:00 pm which was nice because it was less busy. Get the audio tour and take your time wandering this beautiful museum.
Take a guide. We visited the Borghese with a guide from Context Travel and got so much more out of it that we would otherwise. Highly recommend.

Get There Early. This is one of the preeminent galleries in the world. Just for the Bernini sculptures alone it is a must-see.One piece of practical advice: get there early. The gallery admits visitors every two hours, and empties the gallery before admitting the next group. We were in the 9:00 group. When we left at 10:20, there was a very long line to check bags in the coat room for the people in the 11:00 group.There was also a sign stating that Wed. Was completely sold out. So advance purchase is a must! We purchased ours on-line through Select Italy, printed the voucher, presented it at the ticket counter and we were all set.

Fantastic art collection. Galleria Borghese is one of those places where one must go when in Rome. It houses one of the most incredible art collections in town: paintings by Raffaello, Caravaggio, Domenichino as well as breathtaking sculptures by Bernini will take you back to some of the many artistic golden eras of the Italian capital.

Up close and personal with Bernini. After trudging through the Vatican Museums with hordes of people (Christmas week) it was a pleasure to experience the Borghese. Reservations are required and they limit the number of people allowed in every 2 hours and sweep the museum for the next group. As a result, you can get up close to the sculptures without fighting your way through the crowds. The mix of ancient and renaissance art is intriguing. Make sure to rent the audio guide - well worth the 5 euros. Having the time and space to really appreciate Bernini's Apollo and Daphne is worth the price of admission.

well worth a visit. its well worth taking a trip here, Its in a lovely park called villa Borghese where there is a zoo, a train that takes you around and a lovely park scene. Nice to get away from the busy city and have a chill out day here.

Amazing gallery. Get the audio guide, it's well worth the 5euros and unlike other museums it's pretty good and actually gives you a tour through the gallery rather than requiring you to enter numbers for items, which of course you can do as well if you wish. Unmissable in Rome.

Absolute must see when I'm Rome . The villa Borghese is a one stop power tour through the last 2500 years of European history. The best preserved statutes from antiquity and some of the the best renaissance paintings and sculptures (particularly Bernina sculptures and Caravagio paintings impress) all housed in a villa built for the purpose by a billionaire from the time when billionaires knew how to spend their money.

Beautiful Works. The Borghese Gallery is by appointment only so make sure you reserve your time in advance. Beautiful sculptures and paintings adore the walls and rooms. Not a larger gallery and will the 2 hour time limit, it is very easy to see everything.

Gorgeous place. This is a totally worth visit. Small but amazing collection (that is put together in such an unique way that is a most do in Rome). My opinion is that the visit should last even more (you can only stay for a couple of ours) so I could have absorbed every single detail of this wonderful experience.

No reservation: I missed it in Oct 2014. I read and heard great things about the Borghese Museum. However, I did not realize that I needed to make a reservation to get in. Therefore, if you want to see the Borghese Gallery, please make a reservation before heading to Rome. Alternatively, if you will be in Rome for 6 or 7 days, stop by the Gallery on your first day in Rome and purchase your tickets. Even then, you may not get in. Good Luck.
Bernini Bernini Bernini. Amazing collection of Bernini Status, Tiziano, Caravagio a must see if you are in rome. Take a train tour or spend time walking around the garden and amazing views of Rome.

Amazing Bling. A wonderful gallery with incredible sculpture and overall bling. Obviously you must book in advance and do not expect too many rooms as this is quite a small house but if one wanted to you could spend an hour or so here. The gardens surrounding the gallery are lovely and afford great views of Rome.
an overwhelming wealth of artwork. the halls of paintings and sculptures present masterpieces of the most famous artists in roman/italian history.

Seriously, A Reservation? How about letting the world know??. The Borghese Gallery is a hike from town. Took us quite a while to get there. Once there we were told that you need a reservation (even though we were there early and at least outwardly it didn't appear crowded). There wasn't going to be another slot available for at least a week! No where in any guide does it say reservations required. It could be great inside, but beware. Make a reservation and avoid the hassle and disappointment of making your way there only to be denied entry!

Borghese Gallery with Joy of Rome guide Simone. Simone from Joy of Rome was an excellent tour guide. He is an archaeologist and has great insights into the art and culture of Rome. I was advised by my cousin to go to the Galleria Borghese, even just walking around the gardens is worth a visit, however, going into the villa with a guide like Simone was incredible. He showed us the art and explained the politics and history of the Burgese family in conjunction with the background of the artists. I must admit my ignorance of the art we were seeing but after the tour I will say that I am now a fan of Bernini. His sculptures were spectacular, I am not exaggerating that. His sculpture of Pluto and Persephone made marble look as soft as human flesh. Caravaggio's painting were very impressive and once put into context by Simone became even more so. I believe that I would not have gotten half as much out this visit without Simone.

Overflowing collection of art. Reservation process was very simple. We just reserved our tour time - they have two hours visiting slots - from ticket office. The first floor is full of sculptures and the second has paintings. Museum shop, cafeteria etc are in the cellar / group floor.The art collection if overflowing. Also the building and the rooms are masterpieces of art.
Segway tour!!. The bear way to see Rome use segway tours Rome! Beautiful park in centre of Rome, a mini cental park very romantic the park maps are in shape of a heart

Rome 15. Maybe not for everybody. I really enjoyed the sculptures. For me worth the price.there was no line in mid Dec.it's a bit off the beaten path.the walk thru the park was a nice break from the streets of Rome

Mind blowing sculptures. Make this gallery a priority. Located at one end of the beautiful Borghese park (which is a nice respite from the rest of Rome's frenetic streets) the contents of this gallery surprise and delight. It's a distillation of excellent Italian classical art. Digestible. Visually stunning. Yes, there are many masters here: Caravaggio, Bernini, Titian, Raphael. But, besides the stunning sculptures which are front and centre, and the framed oils, don't forget to look up and around. The depictions on the ceilings sometimes match the sculptures and the paintings on the actual walls are finely done.Photos allowed. Mandatory bag check.
Great stop!. Two hours is plenty of time to view the work. One hour would really be enough. Intimate setting with no crowds thanks to reservations being necessary. My husband loved the art displayed.

An experience not to be missed. I have travelled a great deal and this is at the top of my list of favorite locations to view great art. The Bernini sculptures are beyond beautiful- especially the Daphne sculpture. I cannot recommend it highly enough. I need to return again- I barely glanced at the paintings because I was so entranced by the Bernini sculptures.

Disappointment at the Borghese. Due to getting lost we missed our tour. We thought we could do a self tour since we had already paid for our tickets. The receptionist at the Borghese didn't want to hear it. She said they were sold out. We explained there had to be at least two tickets available, as we had paid for them previous. She said they had nothing to do with Viator and dismissed us out of hand. We are not likely to make a return visit.

Poor Signage!. One must purchase entrance tickets on-line. Once you arrive at the Gallery there are entry lines, but no signage indicating where to pick up your tickets. I located the line after running up and down the stairs. I had made the reservation from a B&B and was unable to print my receipt. My phone wasn't working and all I had was the reservation number. The attendants were able to look up number and issue tickets, but the entire process was sloppy. The exhibits are the same I saw 25 years ago and are beautiful. I just wish the gallery could streamline their entrance process. There were dozens of visitors turned away the day we were there and there was plenty of room in the gallery for more people.

Not to be missed - amazing. If you have time to visit only one gallery in Rome this is the one. The gallery is really a palace housing the collection of paintings and sculptures amassed by the Burghese family. It's hard to put in words the over the top quality of the palace and the art displayed. One can do a self guided tour with a rocorded commentary, which can be rented. It is almost impossible to purchase tickets on site. Buy tickets online prior to the day when you want to tour. Because tickets are scheduled for a specific arrival time, with a two hour time limit for seeing the gallery, there is a real limit on the number of tickets available. Do not bother with "skip the line offers", for which you will pay more than double the price of a ticket purchased on line. The length of the line is limited because there is a limit on the number of tickets sold for any particular viewing time. Getting to the gallery will likely require hiring a taxi.

The outside is very nice.. I don't recommend you waste your money on this place. There are so many other places so much more pretty in Rome that is absolutely free. I didn't enjoy it so much and would not go back.
Marvelous. Seeing just Bernini's Pauline, Daphne, Persephone and Aeneas would be worth the price ten times over. And then there's the building, the Caravaggio's..

A good art collection in side a beautiful venue. A nice collection of painting and sculptures of Renaissance's art. I enjoyed mostly the sculptures. Be aware that you can't buy a ticket on the spot and you must order it on-line in advance. Worth a visit!

A Gem. Certainly one of my best gallery experiences ever. A manageable collection of masterpieces viewed in a quiet, intimate setting that allows one to see everything from multiple vantage points without rubbing shoulders with other patrons. I found myself alone in a room with Bernini statues that took my breath away...magnificent. Did you hear me? I said ALONE...in silence...priceless.I recommend booking ahead, arriving early and browsing in the bookstore to refresh your knowledge of the artists and works in the collection. Don't miss this!

How all museums should work!. Beautiful building, amazing art (especially the sculptures). Love the fact that they limit the number of people allowed in each session so it's not at all crowded and you don't feel rushed.

A must see when in Rome. This gallery has a phenomenal art collection and the building itself -- especially the beautiful ceilings that are themselves incredible works of art. Be sure to purchase tickets ahead of time.

Amazing visit. The first tour we did when we hit Rome. This gallery is full of fabulous art and statues. The gallery is a villa of the Cardinal back in the 1600's so just the rooms alone are magnificent. Then each room is filled with a collection of art that dates back to the 1st-3rd centuries. Excellent collection for art enthusiasts. Once you end the gallery then there is a huge garden area and park to walk through that eventually takes you over to the lookout of the city! Key to a happy successful trip through museum and gardens is get a skip the line pass or skip the line guided tour if not you will wait a long time to get in.We had a guide <booked through viator> (Pia) who was very good and explained a lot about the art, the history and the gardens. A must see for art enthusiasts

The best gallery anywhere. Absolutely breathtaking. A collection of masters unequalled anywhere but the Vatican itself, this is a must see in Rome.very reasonable, the kids went free and they were as inspired as we were. The park is amazing. We hired a 4 seater bike to pedal around. Great day.

Beautiful museum and setting. Gallery is lovely and nice and small so you can easily see in a couple of hours without feeling overwhelmed. Set in nice garden setting that you can wander around on foot or rent pedal bikes. Be warned tho - hillier than you think and a struggle to pedal sometimes.

Very Enjoyable. The last museum we visited after having done Florence and Rome, and I felt like we saved the best for last. This place was amazing. Absolutely stunning and definitely worth whatever my wife paid for us to go.

A must-see. Even if you find art boring after an hour, even if you have never heard of Bernini, even if oppulent houses are not your thing: Go there! It's small enough to see within the hour (but you might use more time, because it's so beautiful). The audioguide is quite good, do hire one or participate in a guided tour. It'll give you so much more. The Berninis will impress you, but there are lots and lots more. The gallery's surroundings are very nice as well, on the fine day. The café is very small, a bit expensive, but nice coffee. If you just have time for one thing, choose the Vatican Museum. This should be no. 2.
BOOKING online. It's must see ! You must book your visit in advance at least one week before. the best gallery in the world.

Not worth our time. We only had 3 days in Rome and thought this park with the villa's architecture and gallery might be worth a visit. Wrong decision. Even with the metro it was still quite a walk away. The gallery isn't cheap to visit and has very restricted entry by the hour. And you don't see anything much that's worth your time if you don't pay to get in the tiniest part of the whole big park. We just came from Retiro park in Madrid which was much more worthwhile of our time than this. There are better highlights of Rome to visit if you are here for less than a full week.

A museum not to be missed.. The art in this museum is awe-inspiring. The Borghese collection was the best we saw on our trip which included the Uffizi gallery in Florence before we went to Rome. You need a reservation to visit the gallery. You are allowed only 2 hours in the museum. We wished we had had more time. You can book tours with the many tour companies in Rome. We went with City Wonders Limited. Their guides were excellent.
Fantastic combination of painting, decoration and, architecture. Even If you're in Rome few days dedicate so e time to visit this monument. I suggest booking online tickets.

Beautiful collection!. Lovely collection and building! Tickets must be purchased in advance on the Villa Borghese website, which we did. Unfortunately, the employees had gone on strike without advance notice (other than a piece of paper on the entrance of the villa), so we waited in the garden for 2 hours until the strike was over.
Phenomenal sculpture. Do not miss this museum. It has fabulous artin a magnificent setting with beautiful wooded area nearby.

Fantastic site badly managed. Fantastic masterpieces by Bernini (Apollo e Dafne, Davide, Ratto di Proserpina), Canova (Paolina Borghese) and many Caravaggio paintings. A gallery with so many masterpieces deserves better management: separated ticketing systems between phone and web (why??), poor and old information to guests about , staff rude and unpleasant.

Make time to visit- a must see. You may think your trip to Rome is already jam packed with the usual sites, but this museum is exquisite and a must see. Beautiful sculptures and Bernini's glorious Daphne is here and she alone is worth the trip. Bernini and Michelangelo were remarkable at bringing marble to life. If you think David is amazing, the detail in Daphne will leave you in awe. Just amazing. The gallery is just beautiful and one of the most memorable sites we visited while in Rome. Make time to visit.
very nice Gallery. You must book in advance. Only few people at a time are allowed to enter, so it's not crowdy. Very nice sculptures and ceilings

Lots of art. If you are the type that appreciates art then you should definitely see it, the paintings are amazing and it has a huge park around it where you can rent bikes for two people and you ride a poney or at least ride a carriage pulled by a poney.

An art lovers dream come true!. Wonderful....gorgeous....amazing....awestruck!! The artwork explained by a tour guide is breathtaking! Learn the connection between Borghese and Napolean Bonaparte - very worthwhile visit to surrounding park as well

Marvellous museum. We had taken our tickets in advance and did not regret it, the museum was full for the day. Each room was simply beautiful. Statues were à must. Ceiling paintings were amazing. I enjoyed less the Pinacoteca but anyway it was a top notch museum. Do not miss it or you Will regret it.

Decent gallery selling sandwiches with decayed salami. This gallery includes decent sculptures and paintings. In theory, Roma Pass covers this gallery; however, if booking is made via the website of the gallery, Roma Pass cannot be used; they simply take a full price from you. This gallery has a small cafeteria selling coffee and sandwiches. The sandwiches with salami were decayed and smelly.

Interesting . Once you reach there it's EXTREMLY nice area, we spent there over than 2 hours, it's a free of charge access, but there are activities where you will be paying for, especially the boat tour in the small lake which is very nice

Just Go--It is incredible--26 YO daughter had tears in her eyes w/ a couple of sculptures.. Get tickets in advance via their website; purses and cases have to be checked; clothing can't be checked; the audio tour is decent but you have to keep something that looks like a big Star-Tac phone to your ear--2 hours would do it and there are not many places to sit in the sculpture portion, more in the portrait section. Don't miss it and the neighborhood around it not t mention the park/ gardens are great even in December.

AMAZING! MUST SEE!. I had read that this was not a typical museum and it was not. You are inches from great sculptures while in the Borghese Villa. You can appreciate how the Borghese family lived while experiencing a smaller collection of classics. Not overwhelming like a museum and you can appreciate what you are there to see. I recommend you stroll the park while there and enjoy a moment quiet away from the city.
Gardens are better. A good collection but very limited ticket as you need to book days before your visit. The huge gardens of Villa Borghese is better to go.

The Baroque delights of Rome all in one place. The Villa Borghese is famous for the magnificent collection of mostly Baroque sculptures and paintings, and in particular the major examples of the work of Bernini. This museum shows how a museum should be run. You have to ring to make a booking for a time slot. The operator speaks perfect English, and the whole process takes about 1 minute. We used the Roma Pass so had "free" entry. You arrive 30 minutes before your booking, quote the booking number, and in you go. The galleries are not crowded, and you have time to see everything at your leisure. For those with a serious interest in art, you will be in heaven. Everywhere you turn is an other amazing painting by Carravagio, a sculpture by Bernini, and a myriad of other famous names of the Renaissance and Baroque. We bookeD our time slot early, which was good insofar as the tour groups had not arrived even by the time we left. even if they had, the numbers for each time slot are limited. The gardens and park surrounding the Villa are impressive, and afterwards we walked back into the centre of town.l into

facinating place. it is not a museum but a place where Mr Cardinal Scipione Borghese lived in 1600th and share with you what he liked :gorgious -and sensual sculptures and paintings of young bodies. Exceptional ! 4 or 5 works so precise and so moving of CARAVAGGIO himself the painter criminal..
was disappointed. decor simply seemed over the top. on the other hand, the setting in the park is beautiful and walking through the park is definitely worthwhile

Go!. A beautiful building filled with stunning art that's displayed and lit well. Additionally, it's very organised in that the number of people is limited, which means it's a pleasant and relaxing experience viewing the art. And then the gardens afterwards, or beforehand, are charming and wonderfully landscaped. Highly recommend.

Lovely villa set in attractive green space. The villa was smaller than expected but the quality of the marble sculptures and paintings were superb especially the collection of Caravaggio works, definitely worth the effort to reach it via the two buses.

Sublime. Whether you are an art lover or merely an admirer such as me, the Borghese Gallery is the pinnacle of galleries for fine art and sculpture in Rome. Bernini, Raphael, Rubens just to mention a few. Combined with a stroll through the adjacent park, this makes a perfect day or half-day while in Rome.

If you want to see one museum in Rome it should be this one. It's highly recommended to visit this gallery, sculpture of Bernini and the most important is Appolo and Daphne. The beautiful park around, very romantic.

Wonderful, outstanding.. The Borghese Gallery (Galleria Borghese) not to be confused with Villa Borghese which is actually a big park but more on that in another review.The Galleria Borghese was one of the best attractions we went to, I would even hasten to say imo what we enjoyed most while in Rome, but then we appreciate art and all that goes with it.Do book beforehand as even in low season (November) tickets were sold out for the following 2 or three days.Also tickets are timed so you go in at a certain time and the visit lasts 2 hours.
Great Palace.... This place was wonderful. My wife booked a tour and we were able to go through the gallery and look at the grounds. I am amazed how the rich lived back then...
Amazing!. Amazing collection of statues. However, the younger kids may be uncomfortable with the nudity. Whats up with so many naked man statues?
Art lover Paradise. Our tour of this gallery was just breathtaking. Our tour guide was very exciting. I highly recommend visiting this Villa.

A great way for art/history fans to spend a few hours. A great way for art/history fans to spend a few hours admiring amazing renaissance painting, sculptures, mosaics and more. Tickets are staggered at different times throughout the day, which really helps to limit the amount of people inside at any given time, thus preventing overcrowding

Get there on time! Only two hours and you will need every minute. . By the time you've marveled at Bernini's skill at turning marble into flesh and the gripping Carravaggios, complete with dirty fingernails, you will find you only have half an hour to get through the entire top floor. Your booking lasts just two hours and you will be very well occupied the entire time. I highly recommend the audio guide. Made it possible to get around on time by providing structure.
Something for a change . This is something for a change. If you are looking to get inside, and enjoy some art and beautiful sculptures, this is the place to go!

Spectacular grounds and art. Make sure you purchase tickets in advance or get there very early. We didn't get to tour the gallery because we couldn't get tickets the day we were there. We did spend a great deal of time walking the grounds which are beautiful. You can rent bikes and golf carts to get around. Don't miss the carousel!

excellent art work. i visited the gallery during my visit in 12/2015 for the second time.very important to do advance reservation & show up 20 minutes before the time.i had 9 am time slot & they stated taking people in by 8 :40 am & allowed to enter at 9 a.also get your audio guide.beautiful bernini sclupture & great paintings of renisance artist
A beautiful gallery. This gallery contained beautiful sculptures and paintings alike; definitely worth visiting for the neoclassical art fan.

AMAZING ART & ARCHITECTURE. It's overwhelming to think that this was actually someone's home. It's my favorite collection of sculptures. Make reservations in advance... or you may be disappointed that they are sold out. Make a day of it.. cafe... cute gift shop of replicas... set in a lovely garden to stroll through. They will ask that you check your coat and bags (they'll give you a plastic bag for your wallet & phone. Photos are permitted without flash. Enjoy!!

Galleria Borghese - a Borgia Villa with some of the world's best masterpieces. Within the Villa Borghese Park, this grand party Villa built by the Cardinal nephew of a Borgia pope. It has one level of sculptures, many Roman, Egyptian, and then the more recent Bernini sculptures who designed the beautiful Collonnade entrance into St Peters. There is a second level of paintings, including a room dominated by Reuben and another by Titian works as well as numerous others. We enjoyed a two hour visit. You can only book a two hour slot and you will need the full two hours to explore all the 20 rooms, each with a different theme. We found it less busy than the Vatican museum, with lots more room to wonder round the rooms all with spectacular ceilings and some with Roman mosaic floors. Entry price was 11 euro for adults and 2 euro for under 18 years. Outside we spent another hour wondering the lovely parklands. We didn't have time to visit the zoo.

We couldn't get in. If only we had known we would have booked in advance which has to be done several days before! We had a lovely walk around the surrounding park and went to the museum of modern art instead.

Fabulous! Breathtaking!. A wonderful plan ... reservations must be made and only a limited amount of guests are allowed in every two hours. It is possible to enjoy the wonderful works of art and the building decor. I plan to visit the serene park and the wonderful gallery each time I visit Rome. It is a must see!

Historical building in a giant public garden. I don't go inside the villa. There is a museum vendor inside. Outer appearance is quite satisfying for me :) What beautiful is, the park around villa. It's a huge place where you can go jogging, play with your dog, enjoy the silence and feel the nature. There is also a zoo inside the park. (entry fee:15€). The park is so big that you might spend a whole day there and yet not seen all :)

Bernini!!!. Amazing gallery with a lot of art from ancient roman period and Baroque/ The Bernini sculptures are amazing!!! There are also very good Renaisance and Baroque paintings which are worth seeing - Tician's Amor Sacro e Amor Profano for example is a must.

Awesome art, rude employees. In my experience, I enjoyed visiting the Borghese Gallery, more then I did visiting the Vatican Museums. It was a rich and beautiful experience except for the employees, whom were not friendly, almost rude. When the museum closed, they almost pushed us out. Other than that, walking through the gardens and gazing at the Borgheso collection was very rewarding! It's a must see!

Amazing breadth of art in a beautiful setting. We scheduled the Skip the Line: Borghese Gallery Tour through Viator. Our guide was Emiliano and was so gracious and knowledgeable. You could not hope for a better introduction to the gallery and the villa.

Art lovers can't miss this. If you love art, then you must visit the Borghese. You'll have to book well in advance of your visit to Rome, so plan accordingly. (It's possible to book online before you leave, which I recommend.) The time and price is worth it for the Bernini sculptures along, but the old mansion is filled with Renaissance masterpieces by the likes of Titian and Raphael, and they have some Carravagio paintings as well. A must see.
Awesome artwork. I saw awesome because some of the paintings and sculptures will fill you with awe. Especially Bernini's sculptures or the sculpture of Paullette Bonaparte
Wonderful!. We visited the whole park and py the ticket to enter the villa. Not cheap (12 euros) but worth it. There are many wonderful sculptures and ceiling paintings.

Wow. Just wow.. Do not miss this. It was almost art overload. Some aspect of art was in every direction, from the floors to the ceilings. Completely awestruck by the Bernini sculptures. The audio tour is well worth the few euros, and actually essential if you're not an art scholar. A small cafe is in the basement with reasonable prices for a snack or light lunch.

Incredible collection. So much artwork. I don't know of anywhere you can see so many Bernini sculptures in one place.Here's a tip: find the museum's actual website and reserve your ticket through them. It's cheaper than all the 3rd party vendors by a lot. Take your emailed receipt and pick up your tickets a few minutes before your alloted time.They only let so many people in at a time and a reservation is required.Here's another tip. Don't be the first in the door. Even though there are only about twenty people in the whole group, let them get ahead of you a little and then you can enjoy rooms to yourself. You have two hours. If you really admire all of the artwork it may take you most of that to get through it. Toward the end of your two hours, go back to a room again to enjoy the artwork there most likely by yourself.
Fanastic museum. If you are in Rome then this is a must-see. One of the most fantastic and breathtaking collection of art assembled in a small and beautiful setting.
A must when visiting Rome. Amazing Palazzo filled with the most spectacular sculptures and paintings. Every room is a gem. Definitely prebook and reserve your tickets.

Worth it for Caravaggio. Some of the paintings are masterpieces - the six Caravaggios are wonderful - but signage is poor and I feel the gallery is rather resting on its laurels. That's why I have only given it 4 starsThe Bernini Sculptures are also stunning - much better in real life than in pictures.Visits have to be pre-booked and can only last for 2 hours.

Must see!. Impressive collection of paintings and sculptures in a beautiful estate house in even more beautiful park . Ticket is 11 EUR and you have to book it by phone. Well worth visit. i have been twice.

I was left speechless!!!. I don't think words can help you describe the beauty that you'll see in this gallery. I remember myself being more and more enthusiastic in every new room we were getting in... This place it's a must see!!

Best compact museum I have ever visited.. If you like sculptures be sure to visit this museum. Also make sure you either take a tour or buy the catalogue BEFORE you take take your tour. It's worth the extra euros...

Up close and personal view of some of the most amazing art and sculptures. Being able to see the Bernini sculptures, Apollo and Daphne, The Rape of Proserpina and David from a distance of 2 or 3 feet was amazing. The detail in the the carved marble, the skill of Bernini and the beauty of the sculpture took my breath away. It is hard to comprehend how someone can make such beautiful works of art. This gallery was probably my favorite visit in all of Rome because of the beauty of the works, the intimacy of the setting and the ability to get close to the artwork.
Extraordinary Collection. Instead of rushing in with the herd try the upstairs galleries first and then swop halfway though the 2 hour slot.

Borghese Gallery. The Borghese Gallery was hands down the best museum experience we have had in Rome. If you are a lover of Bernini and Carravaggio, this place would be for you in any environment, but what truly makes this place special is the required advance reservation. Only a very limited number of people are admitted at any one time, so you basically have the galleries to yourselves. This is not the crowded vatican or louvre experience. Imagine being in the room with Bernini's David-all alone. The art is incredible and the experience is worth every penny.
Wow!. I'm not a huge fan of museums but I was told not to miss this one. I'm glad I listened. You must make a reservation before you go. When I was there cameras were allow just no flash.
An excellent collection!. The paintings are very impressive, but some of the sculptures are astonishing; particularly the rape of Persephone. If you love art, you need to visit this place!

Two sides: excellent collection and really bad organization - very impolite. This gallery has all to be one of the best in Italy. Fine position, very, very good collection, from Bernini to Tizian, Raffael, Correggio, Canova and Caravaggio. No other gallery or open place in Rome has better works of Bernini. Inner rooms are interesting and you can admire works in small groups or even alone without pressure when you are inside but just for limited time. I’m trying to enter each time when I visit Rome. Gallery is small and limitations for the visit are reasonable. Problem is organization with bad reservation system. It is not polite to visitors and staff is always nervous, sometimes even brute. Managers of the gallery are nearly never present. They can organize waiting place and entrance inside, from the cellar where they are selling tickets. “System” mix checking of baggage and cloakroom and people of different ages and languages entering, moving to the shop or out. They allow that people wait before the entrance without order in bad weather. It is possible to organize visit in small groups of ten to enter one after another and on some other ways. In theory it is possible that some can enter when others leave; some exit in one hour but people before the doors wait and wait. Bernini, Canova, Tizian, Caravaggio are not guilty. Gallery with more than five stars is pushed to lover level because of bad leadership. Task of the gallery, to promote art and artists is not perfected.

Beautiful gallery in Villa Borghese park.. Beautiful marble sculptures. Go just to see Bernini's Rape of Prosperina. Definitely worth booking online beforehand tosc.it (tickets sell out) and getting the audio guide. Lots of Caravaggios too. Quite a small gallery so the audio tour takes about 1 hour 30 mins.

Great collection; not as well organized as it could be. We went primarily to see the six paintings by Caravaggio - the other treasures by Bernini,et al. were like "dessert". One should go because the paintings and sculptures are superb, but be prepared to be herded into and out of the museum according to a strict timetable. The signage is in Italian with only an occasional brief notice in another language, although the headsets can be ordered in any number of languages. The paintings are not well protected from sun and air and one wishes for more care to be taken to protect these masterpieces.

Do Not Miss This!. We have been to Rome several times in that past few years. We finally made it to the Borghese Gallery. What a beautiful place! The building is incredible. The art is breathtaking! A must see place. Reserve tickets before you go.

Bursting with master works in a stunning setting. The Galleria Borghese is full of masterpieces exhibited in a stunningly beautiful villa in Rome. There are other museums in Rome that feature great paintings displayed in a grand palace (the Doria Pamphilij and the Colonna come to mind), but i found them to be disappointing: the surroundings seem shabby, and the paintings are poorly displayed and lit. The Borghese is many notches above the others. The rooms are breathtaking, the collection is magnificent, and the effect is stunning. Many of the paintings are hung too high to permit close viewing, but that is the only defect. The Bernini sculptures are, by themselves, worth the price of admission, but the collection of paintings is outstanding. They now allow photos, which is nice. Note that your visit is limited to two hours, and the clear the galleries at the end of each two-hour period. If you're serious about art, be sure to buy your tickets ahead of time and consider buying a second ticked for the next two-hour period so that you can spend four hours in paradise. It will be worth it!

Not to be missed. The two hour limit is fine for this wonderful gallery. Spectacular rooms filled with spectacular works of art. Come early and get a nice espresso and panini in the basement bar. Worth every penny of the cost, which is a bargain. Make no mistake, they're serious about the entry/exit times, but please don't miss this when in Rome! While I'm not adding any pics, they now allow photos in the gallery, too.

One Of My Favorite Museums Anywhere. Necessary to purchase tickets before leaving the USA. Be on time. Small museum completely full of invaluable sculpture and paintings. Bernini's and Caravaggio's. All arranged in this palatial residence. Not to be missed..

Superb Renaissance architecture housing the largest private art collection in the world. This exquisite gallery must be seen to be fully appreciated.Housing some of the most valuable and representative Renaissance and Baroque masterpieces of (I.e. Bernini's Apollo and Daphne) , located in a beautifully manicured gardens in the middle of Rome, this gallery is on the very short list of European museums not to be missed.And eventually to be revisited over and over again, just as I do every chance I get.

Not for us. Firstly, the staff are very unhelpful.After getting our tickets (which must be booked in advance), we headed to the main gallery entrance only to be diverted back to store our bags, which was right next to the ticket office! If only they told us!The actual gallery itself is okay, some great work.I'm not exactly a big fan of art, but was open minded when visiting here after reading the reviews.Unless, your into art in a big way then I'd avoid this.

Amazing Art Gallery. Borghese Gallery was an added stop for my husband and I and we were TOTALLY thrilled to have seen it! Book your tickets on line at least a week before your visit or ask hotel staff to help you out with reservation! It's within walking distance from Ancient Rome district and gave us an opportunity to see Via Veneto as well. The art collection at the Gallery is truly amazing. You get ONLY 2 (two) hours to spend there, so use it to your advantage and according to interest! Buy Audio guide - it's worth it! Start from the Pinacoteca on upper floor, featuring masters like Titian, Caravaggio, Raphael, Correggio and many others. Then move to lower floors to admire the unforgettable marble sculptures by Bernini (David, Apollo & Daphne, The Rape of Proserpina, etc.) and Antonio Canova (Venus). Wall and floor mosaics are also worth while seeing! Would visit this gallery again!

Very good. Very good exhibit. On line ticket buying was a breeze. Don't waste your time printing anything. Screenshot the number they send you and you're good to go. Arrive 15 minutes at least before your start time. Go in the lower door centre front. You can take pictures. Just no flash.
nice. a lot to do within two hours. The statues and paintings reminds of very old time. A must while at Rome. It is sometime difficult to get a ticke, book it online.

Take the time to enjoy the art. Magnificent art in amazing villa. Take the full two hours to enjoy the art and then bike,walk around park. Be sure to rent head set as it provides. Interesting information on how art was acquired. Be sure to buy tickets on line well in advance to get the time slot you want. You are limited to the two hour slot you buy tickets fro. Staff at audio guide desk is not customer focused but ticket desk is great.

A Must See museuem of sculptures, painting, other. Fantastic.. Unless you've ever been here and seen the sculptures you'd have trouble appreciating my description of the amazing beauty of the seemingly alive sculptures in this museum. My favorite is "The Rape Of Propina" by Bernini, which seems so real that you find it hard to believe the subjects are marble and not soft flesh. The Bernini's and other fine pieces here are true treasures. If you ever get to Rome, Invest the time and the minimal gate charge to see this museum. Plan a full day here- it is amazing. If I could only visit one place in Rome, it would be hard for me to chose between this and the Vatican Museum & Sisten Chapple. By the way, the Borghese has many paintings as well as sculptures, and it has a pretty decent cafeteria & gift shops too. Cabs all know where this place is, just say BORGESE MUSEUM, even if they do not speak English, this will get you there.

Must see. This was one of my favorite spots to visit. The Gallery is two stories, start on the second floor to avoid the crowd. Your visit is time controlled to two hours, and it can be done in that time. Get the audio guide.Be sure to book your tickets on line, well in advance. The gardens are also great, and they are free.

Lovely artifacts - some even better than the Vatican museum. The place has a lot of old statues and painting and some are better than what you see at the Vatican Museum. You do not get a brochure with your ticket and unless you manage to get hold of a English-language plastic board kept in each room you might struggle to understand what you are looking at, The sheer number of displays may tire you at the end though :-)
Stunning. The museum, the grounds, the park. Exceptional. What a wonderful place to people watch, enjoy magnificent Bernini statues, stroll and breath the fresh air with no traffic !
Magnificent. A Must See!But buy your tickets in advance via internet, because you can only enter during a certain time slot, and tickets are often sold out,

Stunning!. This is one of the few places that not only lives up to its reputation, but actually exceeds it. The timed reservation policy requires some up-front planning, but pays great dividends in that you don't have to suffer immense crowds (which is true of almost every other major sight in Rome). The art itself is spectacular and is a must see for any serious fan of Renaissance Art.
Among the best ones. one of the most consistent museums i've ever been. Very huge and full of great things. The outside plac was also very nice

Better than the Vatican Museam. I had never heard of this Gallery before researching for my trip to Rome. The charm of the Borghese is not just the magnificent art on display but the gallery rooms themselves. Floor to ceiling marble and baroque décor/painting makes the lavishness of the Borghese on par with that of Versailles.You need to book a timed entry to get in. You should not leave Rome without seeing the Borghese.
Amazing!. A must do if you visit Rome! You will find here the best scultures that exist in Rome. You need reservation

Must see. Whilst in Rome, this place is definitely to be seen!It has a beautiful garden and the museum/ gallery is worth visiting.I advice to book on the internet at least a week in advance, depending on the time of year you want to visit it.

Bernini magnifico. I can only say this, go before you die! However TripAdvisor wants me to say more. Just a wonderful experience and easy to get to from Spagna tube station. Just follow the underground walkways. There are places in the park to hire bicycles. Definitely for the fitter sightseer. Book your tickets online in peek times but you are charged a booking fee. Very very helpful staff.

Must see. Loved the Bernini sculpturesOur guide book advised us that we would need the full two hour slot to appreciate everything and gave the tip to start upstairs. It was very busy at the start of our slot but then became much quieter the last half hour which was great to go back and view the sculptures downstairs with no-one else present

Bernini awesome. Loved this. The sculptures by Bernini were exquisite. My youngest and I took the full 2 hours. Definitely have a reservation & the earlier, the less crowded even in November. Afterwards explore the park by bike/segway and walk to the Church of Skulls.

Must-see when in Rome!. I certainly don't consider myself an art buff, but one doesn't need to be one to appreciate all the amazing works contained within. Caravaggio and Bernini headline the impressive collection of works inside these walls, but don't forget to look at the ceilings and floors either! I recommend at least 1 hour, preferably two, and don't forget to call to reserve your visit time well in advance (even with Roma Pass, which I also recommend for value as this is a pricy standalone ticket).
Borghese Gallery. Recommend purchasing the audio guide with your tickets. A visit to Rome would not be completed without a visit to the museum.

Intimate Experience with Bernini and Caravaggio. The title is a bit more erotic than intended, but you get the idea. The gallery is very small and personal. You get a chance to be up close and experience the art at your own pace and speed. Do the upstairs first (Pinacoteca) to beat the crowds, although the main attractions are on the first floor. I'm by no means an art history guy, but I was absolutely blown away by Bernini's skill with marble. Relish the details in how he brings the stone to life. A must visit in Rome.
Peaceful garden and impressive Gallery. Huge garden with beautiful buildingsThe gallery is big impressive and interestingwe took the guided tour
must do. is something you must see in rome. also recomend the audioguide. the rest is just pure enjoyment. Art and beauty everywhere
Nice!. In order to visit here, book in advance or be prepared for long queues! There is a beautiful park here..and the galleries have some amazing art-work pieces! Audio-guide is recommended!
Excellent. A great walk through the park to a lovely building and the Bernini sculptures the Caravaggios were wonderful. Could have stayed longer - you need at least 4hours.
Amazing. We didn't have a guide because my friend is a curator for a museum and knew everything. However, this place speaks for itself! Excellence & Beauty in its purest form!!

Very cool, if you're into sculptures. Yes, the Berninis are stunning, especially The Rape of Propserpina (just look at the way his fingers sink into the flesh of her thigh...wow), and Caravaggio's Saint Jerome Writing is there, but otherwise this was a whole lot of sculpture for me. We enjoyed having a walk around and taking everything in, but there probably aren't tons of people I'd recommend this one to.

Pre-booking is a must. This is the one place where you will have to get your ticket quite in advance, as tickets are often sold out for days or weeks. Do be careful and make sure that you get the right entrance, as it's a long walk from the entrance to the park which is in front of the gallery. The audio guide is recommended given the sheer number of pieces in the gallery, and the lack of information on the pieces in the gallery itself.
Best park. Very nice park in the city center to have a break and have fun with the kids. There is a nice zoo in the park and a kids area where you can rent a bike or take the park train.

Definitely a must do in Rome!. If I had to pick only one museum in Roma. I'll probably go for Borghese Gallery where I spent a very culturally interesting moment. It took me just over 2 hours to do the gallery with the audio guide, which was completely worth it. The art exposed there is absolutely fascinating.Don't forget to walk in the park after or before the visit!

Did not disappoint!. There was so much to see here! It was all beautiful. The Bernini sculptures and Caravaggio paintings were the highlights for me!We were worried beforehand that two hours wouldn't be enough time for us to see everything, but it turned out to be plenty of time. If you can, plan your visit so you have time to explore the beautiful park and gardens around the estate before or after you go to the gallery.

One of the top museums in the world. The Bernini sculptures are spectacular. These are incredible works of art. The skill and talent needed to create these pieces leaves one in awe. Be sure to make reservations. I've seen more than a few people turned away at the door.
Wonderful museum where Bernini is one of the Gods. Make sure to buy tickets on line ahead of time, it fills up quickly. Leave some time to meander through the beautiful gardens.

Beautiful gallery. This place is jam-packed with great art. The audio guide is definitely worth it - you get the nitty-gritty (dirty) details behind the art (and its not-always-so-legit acquisition). This place is a must see on a trip to Rome.

Fabulous museum in beautiful building. Even if you're not much of an art-museum-goer, this place is really interesting and beautiful. Also, I don't usually find audio tours very useful but the one here is very well done and definitely worth paying for.

Beautiful museum !. We booked our tour online via dark Roman tours.com , you need to because you can't actually get in without these ticketsAnd you can't buy at a ticket desk. located in the villas de borgese, beautful area where there is plenty to do , whether go to the zoo or grab a boat and row on the lake. When we arrived at the borghese museum to be by greeted by John , our guide ! John was brilliant ,he is from American so English brilliant and gave us our tickets. Each ticket is different ,and has a painting/sculpture on it, which was cool. We were guided around and explained each painting or sculptor if there was any story or anything about the creator , John knew his history. I would recommend to all , amazing building , very beautiful , a must see in Rome.
Beautiful gallery!. A must see! An incredible amount of art that is sure to overwhelm.The entire interior of the gallery is a work of art in itself.

Beautifully displayed art works. Reservations and limited time allowed make this a pleasant experience, not too crowded. I headed to the second floor first since most of those entering stayed on the first floor. Easier to appreciate the art. One thing I found incongruent was a very modern fashion show interspersed through the ancient art. Modern leather dresses next to a Bernini? But the crowd control made for a much better experience than the Vatican museum.
The nicest !. Nicest museum in Rome ! A must ! After the Vatican museums (which are too big for my taste), enjoy the beauty of world famous statues. Pre-booking is highly recommended.
Amazing. If you love Bernini as I do and Caravaggio then this place is a must see. Apollo and Daphne is my all time favorite statue. Also the grounds are an oasis of tranquility.
A Must. A wonderful museum with an interesting history and works by important artists. Reservations are a must.

Paintings and statues of outstanding collection. After the Vatican Museum, this art gallery has many outstanding collection of pictures from the Renascence, with works from Caravaggio and Tizian and amazing statues from Barberini. Also the seilings pictures are amaizing.The beautiful gardens and fontains, with street musicians in every corner, and the look from the terrace towards the Piazza Populo were great experiences.It's better to buy the tickets in the web site of Gallery Borghese.

ART of the highest level. Borghese Galleries. If you have been, you know it's amazing. If you've not, then go. Reserve your tickets (a must) and go. The reserving limits the number of people strolling thru the galleries. Art, sculpture--it's there.

another must see. Outstanding collection. Unwind in the park if you're tired after several days dodging scooters. Our visit was mid November and we were able to gain entry without reservation. TIP: leave your purse back at your hotel because all bags, including purses, must go into storage which is a long line-up (at least 1/2 hr for both storage and retrieval) Cameras are OK.Good little coffee shop.
Amazing!. Beautiful art and we were lucky enough to see a fashion exhibit that's been installed there for a while. It's beautifully set in the Villa Borghese. Don't miss it!

World Class Museum. This is an amazing gallery with major masterpieces in every room. I recommend you get an audio tour for this museum. While we were there they had designed dresses placed throughout the gallery - giving it a refreshingly modern look to the gallery. We found the museum hard to get to and hard to get back from if you go at night and recommend a taxi. We took a wrong turn and ended up walking through the park in pitch dark until we ran across Piazza del Popolo It is highly recommended that you book a time either by phone or on the Internet to come to this Museum. Arrive thirty minutes early,. You must check any bags. Non flash pictures were allowed. We ate at the cafe at the bottom floor of the gallery, the food was quite good. I would not got to this gallery without reading up on the works of art and the history of the gallery first.

Must See Gallery in Rome. Had heard that if you’re going to visit one museum in Rome, the Borghese is the one. It lived up to the reputation. It’s not a huge museum, but it is packed. The time window is usually two hours and can be done in two hours. The tickets can be reserved on-line. PLAN AHEAD and BUY TICKETS ON-LINE. There were so many visitors who were showing up the day of and hoping to get in, when I went the tickets were sold out for at least a week. The museum has an impressive statute collection surrounded by paintings. Reminds me of the Barnes in Philadelphia. The acquisition means are very different, but similar in scope, display and concentrated impact. The Borghese is located in a park that is beautiful to walk around in as well.

If you only go to one museum, this is it. A beautiful museum in a lovely park. It was almost unreal to see all the Bernini works up close, they are so unbelievable. The Azzadine Alaïa exhibition was a nice plus.Has to be booked in advance.
Treasure. Magnificent Bernini sculptures that shouldn't be missed!! Many Italian paintings. Small museum, so must buy tickets ahead, as they are timed in 2 hour intervals.

Spectacular . Unbelievable collection of Bernini sculptures among others. Entry times are reserved so schedule of line ahead of timeLocated in a more residential area, so not many restaurants or shops nearby
Amazing work of art. Been to so many museums but this one is the best in Rome! There is also the opportunity to visit the gardens and take a boat trip to the other side of the villa...enjoy

Gorgeous borghese. Book in advance!! If you don't you probably won't get in. We went on a Tuesday in November and the whole day was booked out. It is complete Italian over-the-top fabulousness. Decoration and sculpture everywhere you look. You get two hours to look around but one hour is enough. I loved this gallery

Take your time, wear good shoes AND get tickets in advance. The Borghese gallery is about a 10 euro taxi ride from the coliseum. The gallery has three floors. Order tickets in advance, since they are usually sold out. Bring your receipt to someone in a blue jacket standing outside the museum, then walk down the steps to the book store to check in all of your bags. Although the web site said you cannot take pictures I asked and was told - You ARE allowed a camera but no flash – bring a monopod. This is also where you can rent a audio guide or join a group. Since it is already costing you a fair amount of money get the most out of your visit and get one of them. We rented an audio guide for about 5 euro. FYI there are two stories with a narrow staircase leading up - no elevator available when we went . One more important point I was told by the guide that ( as when we were there) the bathrooms are often closed . In short - we loved it and spend as long as they let us – two hours.

A place to stroll and see brilliant works of art.. Very good plus other sites within the park to visit, high quality everywhere. An exhibition of clothes as art included in November 2015 whited added interest from a modern time to the art and sculpture of times past. Enjoyed the park as well.

We loved the surronding park. My family and I l(kids 10 and 12) loved the park so much that we didn't make it into the museum. We rented a four seater bike and toured the grounds and laughed it up. The brakes were terrible on the bike which caused for some pretty scary/funny episodes. Then the kids rented scooters for an hour as my wife and I watched the sunset over Rome. What a great surprise this was!
don't miss this one. still my most favourite ever gallery in the world. Small, beautiful, easy to enjoy the whole lot, and set in gorgeous gardens. Just do make sure you book.

Excellent, excellent. This is a jewel of a museum but buy your tickets on-line or you may not get to enter. Better yet, get a guided tour. The place is wonderful, the history interesting and the statues breathtaking.

Beautiful Borghese Gallery. There are several museums in Borghese Park and I am so happy we chose this one. It has an extensive collection of statuary and painting and the building itself is gorgeous. Do pay the 5 euros for the audio tour, it is well worth it. You will see works by Bernini, Titian, Rubens, and many more. You get to spend 90 minutes in the gallery. There is a bookstore and cafe downstairs. Amazing collection!

Magnificent property full of art treasures. Not bad for what was a family "weekender".. The Borghese Gallery is another "must see" in Rome. It is a marvelous property full of the Borghese family's art collection treasures. Many magnificent sculptures and paintings.Would thoroughly recommend a guided tour to maximise the experience.

Borghese Gallery Piazzale del Museo Borghese Rome. This gallery is the former home of the Borghese family. It is on the most beautiful grounds and filled with wonderful treasures. The architecture detail of the home is amazing. it should be on your list of must sees. Tickets required.

Heaven for 90 minutes. This is in my opinion, the best art gallery in all of Rome. In the early 1600's Cardinal Scipione Borghese created his gallery and housed it in this beautiful building. Unlike other great collections, this building was created as a museum not a home. All available surfaces are painted on with unbelievable frescoes. Words cannot describe the beauty.The cardinal obtained his art with a heavy hand. It was not beneath him to brow beat, cajole or threaten to get his art and he did a great job too! Tickets are needed before you go and you can get them on line. You have a bit less than 2 hours to view the pieces. 360 people are let in each 2 hours so if you've a mind to prepare, do some reading about the collection. I recommend starting on the top floor. Everyone starts on the bottom and it's more crowded.i heartily recommend getting the audio guide. It's lovely to be told the stories and gossip surrounding the pictures and artists as well as the Cardinale.There is a coat check and you must check backpacks, large purses, and briefcases. You are allowed to photograph the art but without flash so IPads are greatThere is a small snack bar mostly sweets, coffee and drinks. Hint, pay for what you want first then go over to the other counter and order it. I waited for Bout 10 minutes to order only to be told to pay first.The staff are very nice. My a partner uses a cane and the woman staffing the desk asked us if we wanted to use the elevator. This was handy as it dropped us on the 3 rd level so we could walk down. Oh, I almost lost sleep over the ticket retrieval. It says you must produce a picture ID and the voucher must be printed out. We were not staying in a hotel so printing wasn't an option. In Rome these days there aren't many Internet cafe's in fact we found 2 and each one said their printers were down ( probably for years) so with heart in mouth I approached the woman behind the desk to get out tickets. Had my passport and my driving license. She asked my name, clicked on the computer and Viola! My tickets. So don't go to extraordinary lengths to get the voucher printed. We took every minute of the allotted time. There was so much to see. I could have used at least another half hour but nonetheless this is a collection not to be missed. I left the gallery walking 2 inches above the ground. I had been in heaven.

The Borghese Gallery. If time permits, this should be on every tourists list to visit. I was amazed at the beautiful paintings, even on the ceilings. There are some magnificent sculptures. I would highly recommend this gallery.

Lovely Afternoon. Buy tickets in advance because I guess they sell out. This way you have a set time to go in (two hours max) to see the place. I enjoyed taking a guided tour with an art guide, because you can really get the background of the place and not miss important pieces - but I think they also have audio guides if you want to do it yourself. The parks are beautiful and you can certainly spend a couple of hours there and walk to Spanish stairs or other central Rome locations.

Don't leave Rome without going to Borghese Gallery. It is a magical place....the art is mind-blowing, so is the location.easy to get to, u can walk around the whole Villa Borghese area and refresh your senses. but do be aware that u need prior booking of tickets or expect to wait it out for your time-slot to enter

Awesome, the best museum in Rome.. It´s small, but it´s perfect. If you are in rome, you must visit this place. Why?Because it's a little museum, with increible pieces of art; you will not be bothered by other visitors because there are limited capacity, only 200 person could be inside.On the other hand there are the most beautiful Bernini´s pieces.
